Reviews.Title: “Historic property in a city without many of its kind”
Reviews.Author: dickanddoug
Reviews.Content: I agree with Nvizble, and will not repeat. Went there with my wife for anniversary weekend because I wanted to try it. The rooms are listed as 500 sq ft on Expedia, but live a lot smaller. Lots of wasted space in bath and in room, with only one easy chair and one small desk/desk chair. No love seat or coffee table, not a good layout for hanging out in the room reading paper, drinking coffee, facing one another. Service was very good, the bed was great, we enjoyed both the historic bar and restaurant Juno on 1st floor. Free newspapers including Sunday in the bar/lobby. While the location is well south of downtown and Pike Place Market, still very walkable, and equidistant to International District and Pioneer Sq., ferries, stadiums. Suggestion for breakfast - go out walking about four short blocks to Grand Central Bakery in Pioneer Sq on 1st Ave for outstanding fresh croissants with jam and/or pecan sticky buns. Open early, even on Sun. Eat there or bring back to enjoy w French press coffee in your room. The minibar fridge in room has enough space for leftovers from your dinner out, another nice amenity. Room also has DVD player. Bring your Netflix envelopes if you think you'd fancy a night in. Enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find -”
Reviews.Author: Donna M
Reviews.Content: fantastic accommodations, reasonably priced, large rooms, great bed and bathroom...comfortable lobby

Reviews.Title: “Swanky and old school with a lot of class”
Reviews.Author: Nvizble
Reviews.Content: The only drawback to this location is that it is in the Financial district, and not in the "action" of downtown/shopping. Rooms were small but comfy and the service was perfect. The on site bar was lively and active (I had an absinthe there!) and the on site restaurant was very good. Loved the French press coffee in room. Short walk to most places.

Reviews.Title: “One of the coolest hotels around...”
Reviews.Author: BigSkyEditor
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable charming remodeled historic hotel in the heart of downtown. Feels like you are stepping back in time to the early 20th century, yet the hotels has all the modern conveniences of today (hard to even tell is part of the Hilton chain). Accommodating staff, comfortable rooms (some may think they are a little on the small side compared to chain hotels but they are plenty big enough). Nice upscale bar (Polar Bar) in back of lobby the serves small bites, and just about any drink you can imagine. June restaurant is attached to hotel, did not eat there but looked amazing. Great downtown location, can walk to just about anywhere. Would be great hotel for romantic getaway, special occasion, etc. When you have a choice to stay at someplace like this among all of the other cookie cutter chains, why not? Will definitely be back to this place!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: FrauReisende
Reviews.Content: While offering all the modern amenities you expect from a Doubletree, this hotel leapfrogs over the sterile, bland sameness of most modern hotels, and gives you a glimpse of grand era in travel. The rooms are lovely. It you want the biggest, blandest, coldest, most ultra-modern room decor, don't go here. But if you want charm and elegance, this is a great place. But I mostly wanted to write a review because the service was so truly exceptional. I was in the room while my room was being made up and watched the care with which the bed was being made. Every staff person we encountered was just the right combination of accommodating, competent, professional and just plain nice. This place obviously has a great manager.

Reviews.Title: “"The Perfect Place to Stay in Seattle"”
Reviews.Author: Joepure
Reviews.Content: The Arctic Club Seattle - operated by the Hilton/Doubletree management is by far, the most interesting and enjoyable place I have stayed in downtown Seattle in many years. The former "explorer's" club, located on 3rd Ave in Pioneer Square is a real gem among the modern cookie-cutter hotels found in large cities. The 100 year old building has been completely renovated to a contemporary interpretation of its 19th century origins. Tall ceilings and windows, dark woods, large rooms and phenomenal bathrooms make the time spent at the property almost as fun as exploring the city. The service staff are all friendly and very helpful - to the point as if you were a member of the "club" rather than just another guest in a room. I can't imagine staying at another hotel when in Seattle! PS: My only small complaint is that the very efficient air/heating system in my room was a bit obtrusive - not to the point of bothering me but it is noticeable.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Seattle hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaTraveler7777
Reviews.Content: This is one unusual place, festooned with carvings of walrus heads around the building and walrus heads above the room numbers beside the doors. They have successfully updated the 100-year old hotel and it is now in the Doubletree/Hilton chain, but the most unusual of them all, would be my guess. It's got a great lobby bar that was apparently stolen in the middle of the night by the drunken Klondike millionaires who formed the club in another hotel and were asked to vacate the premises. The rooms are very big and decorated in a modern version of that period. It's quiet, the beds are first-rate, it's within walking distance of both the ballparks and the downtown places like Pike Place Market. It's so nice to be in a hotel with some personality and there's nothing like this place anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary treat”
Reviews.Author: inlove56003
Reviews.Content: This hotel took us into a world forgotten by modernity. We loved all of the decor, comforts, high class surroundings of this place. We celebrated our 38th anniversary here, and would do it all over again.

Reviews.Title: “Not your average business hotel......”
Reviews.Author: BinThereAteThat
Reviews.Content: The Arctic Club is a quirky ex-gentlemans club which is now a Hilton/Doubletree property. Wonderful charm to the common areas, great bar (and barman - Hi Viktor), great staff, good location - no real minus points for the business traveller who is looking for something a little different from the usual chain experience. Visited 5 or 6 times now - consistently comfy and no complaints. Wouldn't go there with kids - would feel out of place and the access has steep stairs which could be difficult for little ones. Otherwise - 2 enthusiastic thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “A welcome departure from usual corporate hotel”
Reviews.Author: section
Reviews.Content: As many have said, the decor is charming and rustic. I really liked the wood beamed ceilings versus the de facto white spackle. Due to the steep hill, the main entrance is up several steps but there is an accessible entrance around the corner with an elevator to the lobby floor. It's an excellent location and the presence of the valets and doormen deter the usual Pioneer Square junkies from lingering at the doorway. The staff was helpful and friendly and available at all hours. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Seattle Adventure”
Reviews.Author: Ronald M
Reviews.Content: A lot of history and great service. Excellent lounge and a lot of character. Right next to City Hall and in front of the Columbia building. Exit Pioneer Square station if you take the train from SeaTac. Only negative is walk a block south and the area gets quite shady.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting property/ good location”
Reviews.Author: michael77092
Reviews.Content: Just left The Arctic Club after a weekend stay. I am giving this hotel a "very good" rating. The hotel has a great masculine vibe from the lobby all the way up to the rooms. The property is in a good location within walking distance to the Pike Place Market, the Seattle Art Museum, and good restaurants and shops. I found all of the hotel staff to be very friendly and accommodating. As a Hilton Honors Diamond member I received free internet, but even if I were paying out of pocket, internet was only $9.95/ day. Also received a $12/ day breakfast allowance which made for a nice breakfast each morning. The hotel bed was also very comfortable. The onsite restaurant, Juno, is not bad, but is also nothing super special. I would say it is standard hotel food; no better, no worse. The front desk staff and the all of the gentlemen at the concierge desk were very helpful. I was super impressed with just how genuine everyone seemed. It was evident to me that this property really stresses customer service with their staff. For anyone concerned about hotel security, this is the place to stay. Anything above the 3rd floor requires a hotel key for entry 24/7. Staff is always present and would immediately recognize anything out of the ordinary. Lastly, as a word of caution, the hotel is on a bit of an incline, so walking to and from in the area is taxing for someone not accustomed to walking much. That is not just true of the hotel, but of basically anything above 2nd Avenue downtown. I enjoyed my weekend in Seattle and this hotel played a big part in making the weekend so fun...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: dcape
Reviews.Content: Ultra cool hotel with a great staff and superb barkeeper! A bucket list hotel for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Andypf
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff at check in (with their delicious cookies), great location - just a short walk away from the markets, shops and cafes and right near a light rail station. Hotel overall felt very polished; the room was excellent: well appointed, relatively spacious and clean. Room service was prompt and helpful. All up, very enjoyable stay and good value.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful and classy place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Mike H
Reviews.Content: I was in Seattle late February on business and needed to stay in the city. I picked the Artic Club in a somewhat random fashion and was glad I did. It's a really neat, classy hotel and definitely worth the money. The hotel was an old Gentelmen's Club (not that kind) that was later taken over by the City due to unpaid taxes. Purchased and rennovated in 2006 it really is a fun and charming place to stay. The lobby bar alone is worth the trip and the hotel staff is really friendly and pleasant. If you stay there, take a peek at the 2nd floor ballroom. The stainglass dome is worth the effort.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: westozscot
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and found this to be a good value, well located hotel. Room was comfortable, and service friendly. Lovely "Club" style bar & lounge which is good for a nightcap. Bus is just outside the door, and there is a good selection of restaurants and bars just down the street. Only downside was difficulty in getting a taxi one morning. The front desk had booked one for us and called again after 15 mins, but none appeared so we ended up just catching a bus! Staff mentioned that many taxi drivers don't know the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a very central location”
Reviews.Author: roadtravelled09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and we really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is situated in a very central location to explore Seattle by foot or public transport. The hotel is beautifully decorated both inside and outside. The room was very spacious as was the bathroom and it had everything we needed during our stay. All the staff were all very helpful and the cookie on arrival is a very nice touch.The bar is a very relaxing place to chill out after a busy day in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff great hotel”
Reviews.Author: James M
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Hanging out at the bar is like stepping back in time. All of the front desk staff are really helpful and take the time to address any of your concerns. You will find Viktor and Zenee at the bar and they are the best in the city. You won't be dissappointed staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Bar Staff”
Reviews.Author: John Z
Reviews.Content: The Polar Bar staff is the best in the country. Viktor and Zenee are the most knowledgeable bar tenders I have ever met, and make the best drinks. I look forward to seeing them everytime I come to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with great character!”
Reviews.Author: GDP33
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is in the Double Tree chain it feels like an independent boutique hotel. The whole hotel oozes character: the sense of staying at an old world gentlemen's club is invoked with wood paneling, old prints and photographs on the wall and bespoke furniture in the bedrooms. The rooms are well proportioned and whoever designed the bathrooms did a fantastic job. This hotel has a sense of place and history. It is not too hard to imagine that logger barons or those who made it big in the gold rush of yore came to stay in a place like this on trips to Seattle. There is Wifi throughout the hotel. The staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful. The location is walking distance from all the main tourist attractions in downtown Seattle and equally convenient for business. A short cab ride will take you to the hip restaurants and nightlife of the Cap Hill area. The gym has two treadmills, an elliptical trainer and a strength training machine. I had a great stay and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Classy place, top notch staff and an interesting choice in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Kat&John
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel to celebrate my special lady friend's birthday. Front desk staff got things off to a great start by being friendly and attentive. (I wish I could remember her name, but she worked the afternoon of January 27) We chatted about the history of the hotel and when I mentioned it was my wife's birthday, she offered a few things that really made the stay special -without me even asking! This is an historic property with a real old hotel feel but none of the downside of an old hotel. The place was immaculately clean, dust free, warm, clean and stately. The decor was very stylish but also very comfortable. We had a room on the top floor with a sort of balcony that was on the roof with a great view of the city. The bed/linens were extremely comfortable and this place must be built for the zombie apocalypse since we heard no noises (other than some street noise.) The in-room amenities included a full set up to make french press coffee and a minibar. The bath had gorgeous tile. For some reason, they associate the DoubleTree brand with this property, which might not be the best idea, because of the unevenness of other DoubleTree hotels; I'd just leave that part out. This is an unusual hotel that makes you feel like you are living in the 30's. I felt like I might run into Nucky Thompson in the Polar Bar, which was also a great place to hang out. If you are flying in, bear in mind that this is directly across the street from the Pioneer Square Station of the Seattle light rail, so for just $2.50 you ride from the airport to the hotel. The neighborhood has some good restaurants and is close to Pioneer square.

Reviews.Title: “Staff Training must be Best in Business”
Reviews.Author: RogerDave
Reviews.Content: Hyper-attentive service in-house; get directions from desk, valets seem from out of state. Entry on Third (where GPS sent us) problematic; use elevator phone to contact desk or enter at Cherry. Happy Hour ends earlier in Polar Bar than Juno but drinks are better. Rebate for not taking USA Today. Easy public transport, connects to SeaTac. NOTE: the cool ambiance makes up for easily disernable street noise, HOWEVER there is a building site to the south. Avoid this property when construction begins: it will be too noisy. Foam pillows are available; trust the staff's willingness to accomodate you, tell 'em what you need if they haven't already anticipated it. Take in a meal & a show at Jazz Alley: free parking there.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: Joan E
Reviews.Content: After struggling to narrow down the many choices of hotels in Seattle, I chose the Artic Club. I was not disappointed. The lobby and room were both styled as one would expect from a 100 year old hotel. A fireplace in the lobby with wooden accents, detailed molding in the room and a beautifully decorated bathrom contributed to an old world feel. Service was great and of course the warm Doubletree cookie upon arrival is a wonderful bonus. The hotel was a block from the Metropolitan Grill and about 1/2 mile from Pike's Market in one direction and less than that to the Amtrak Station in the other.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: Julie H
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel convenient locale approx 10 blocks from Pike Place Mkt; nicely upgraded rooms, friendly staff. Very good value! Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience at a historic Seattle hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Luka302
Reviews.Content: The Artic Club is a Seattle landmark. The Doubletree has incorporated this history with its usual high quality service and hospitality. The setting is great in downtown, yet the intimacy of this property makes it a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: like2try
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four night on vacation. The hotel is beautiful, and the service is great. Yes, the rooms are a little small, but I love historical buildings and I love what they have done to preserve this amazing building. The Polar Bar was awesome, and the lounge is beautiful. Juno the restaurant in the hotel was pretty good as well, especially for breakfast. The bar menu is very good. We will definitely go back. The only problem we had was the heater in our room was quite noisy. We didn't say anything because we didn't want to change rooms. I'm sure if we would have we would have been accomadated.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: sara p
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the arctic club while in town for dinner with 3 couples. Paid $135 online per room. Valet parking was expensive but no options. This hotel impressed from the first step in the door. Great staff with stories of the history of the hotel, warm cookies at check in, lovely rooms, great lounge with a huge fireplace and strong drinks! Had a perfect breakfast downstairs at Luna and headed home. I strongly recommend this hotel and will definately stay there when in Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “"Hidden Secret in Seattle"”
Reviews.Author: frasier10
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel in downtown Seattle. Reasonable. $ Large rooms with historic architecture and modern amenities. Walk back in time in the former Men's club lobby and receive a warm cookie. Have a drink by the fireplace in the bar or play a game of billiards. Loved the ambiance of the entire hotel; staff, the grandeur of the dome room where my daughter was married and the 10th floor balcony rooms! We walked to Pikes Market & downtown shops. The only concern was the valet parking. While I new it was $32/day, I was not told about all the taxes adding another $9/day to the cost. Plenty of other secure parking nearby during the week, just not secure on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Warm romantic winter retreat”
Reviews.Author: tiggerboo89
Reviews.Content: We were there for new years and our honeymoon. Warm Friendly staff greeted us every time we were in the lobby. fireplace and bar in lobby, gym and restaurant.. room was quiet and private. Short walking distance to pike place market and shopping. not a fan of the valet parking fee. And that is the only parking available. but would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Lovely details, comfy room, great location”
Reviews.Author: Gemutlichkeit
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights recently and the staff could not have been more friendly or accommodating. The location is great - close to transit stops, but I simply walked everywhere. I had only one meal there --- some late-night room service, and I even Facebooked to my friends how innovative and tasty that one silly snack was! Highly recommended. I can't speak to any of the other amenities of the hotel (fitness room, restaurant, bar, etc). What I particularly enjoyed was the care with which they restored the hotel. I loved the architecture of the building itself, but the care of the re-design and the details -- really great. Lovely colors. Modern but appropriately retro features, including reproduction doors and inspired lighting features. I found the elevator number panel particularly amusing, though I'm not entirely sure it was intended to sound like a submarine. I had only 2 problems while I was there. One, I had requested a corner room (which allowed for great light, but also increased street noise - be prepared if you are sensitive to this). This gave me lovely partial views of Rainier and the Sound, but also let me overlook a construction site. I asked for a room change to a better view, but they were not able to provide one with similar features. Seeing the placement of the hotel in daylight, I could see why - because it is a historic hotel, it is moderately dwarfed by its neighbors, which means no one has a tremendous view; and the hotel is blocked by other properties. But that's really just fine - I was there for sleeping and working, and you can enjoy all the fantastic views of Seattle by getting out. My other problem was a clogged sink, and I only reported it upon checkout. I do believe someone had jammed the sink with tobacco, because there was an odor of tobacco whenever I ran water. Again, as soon as I reported the problem upon checkout, the concierge was calling maintenance in to unclog the sink. Highly recommended - would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Clean Room”
Reviews.Author: LovellFord
Reviews.Content: The staff was great, the room was clean and beautifully restored; we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kozamel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at least once a month between Feb and June 2011. GREAT Hotel! Super friendly staff - they remembered me after the 2nd visit and always put me in a corner room. The lobby bar is wonderful, low key, quiet and classy. Everyone I encountered was helpful and friendly. I really enjoyed the history of the place. Be prepared, the bathrooms are kind of dark - but very well appointed. French press in-room coffee was an appreciated touch. Wish work would bring me back to Seattle again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Artic Club”
Reviews.Author: Catravel0r
Reviews.Content: We found the customer service during our Dec 2011 vacation at the Artic Club to be top notch. They were very accomodating about our needs and the front desk set us up in the same room when we returned from an overnight in Vancouver since we loved the room. The Artic northern light dome room is breathtaking with stained lights and carved wood shaped into a dome .....the room was being set up for a wedding and it was a sight to see. Great old bones to this hotel with charm, clean and outstanding food in hotel restaurant and room service. We will stay here again, do not be concerned with booking at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Gentelmen's Club”
Reviews.Author: LillyPBellevue_WA
Reviews.Content: If the Art of Shaving designed a hotel I imagine this is what it would be like. Loved the decor and cozy feel to the place. Had corner room on top floor (10th) with a balcony. Seating area with club chairs and couch as well as a desk. Breakfast at restaurant also tasty. Only complaint was that the wine by the glass selection was middling at best. Then again, in this setting with the prints of notable Seattlites from the 1920s and pool table adorning the lobby, it may have been a better call to have gone with the martini. Easy walk to most attractions or quick bus ride to places like Space Needle. More of a business hotel than a place to go for a romantic getaway but lots of character. Staff was also very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to be excited about”
Reviews.Author: fuego2u
Reviews.Content: The service was good. The cookie they gave me was tasty. The place was... rustic. I understand that was their theme, but my toilet was broken when I came into the room and the dresser is an old school awkward design that I did not enjoy using. I had to open three sets of doors to get my underwear in the morning... The flat screen tv was nice, but kind of awkwardly situated. The lobby downstairs however is pretty cool. They have a nice rustic themed bar and a pool table for use, which is pretty nice. The staff was super nice and friendly, and the hotel is situated right above the underground bus which can take you to the main shopping area two stops away. The street traffic is pretty loud, but the noise of the vents to heat the room was even louder. I did not really mind either of these as I am a heavy sleeper as it is. There was no view from the room which I was not too happy about, but other than all of these things my stay was adequate. I wouldn't mind coming back, but I am not pining for it.

Reviews.Title: “A grand historic hotel with wonderful rooms.”
Reviews.Author: RDHOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: My expectations are rarely exceeded, but when I arrived at the Arctic Club they were. Friends and I arrived by train and the hotel was a short cab ride from the Amtrak station (if the weather were nice we would have walked). As we pulled up to the entrance in our cab we were met by the doorman and a bellman and escorted to the front desk. Check-in was fast and friendly and we each got a Doubletree signature chocolate chip cookie (which I greatly enjoy). Our rooms were amazing! The decor is based on the historic gentleman's club nature of the hotel with countless touches including old photos. Our rooms had every convenience and the furniture was very comfortable. Like all Doubletree Hotels this one had a wonderful bed with many pillows and I had an excellent night's sleep. We had a nightcap in the lobby bar, which has wonderful 1920's decor and an expert and friendly bartender. Unfortunately, we had to check out early to catch our train, so did not try the restaurant which looked inviting. Check-out was very efficient and, again, very friendly. The bellman even showed us the grand third floor function room with elegant decor including a glass ceiling. I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Seattle! In fact, I have a reservation to return on January 13, and this time will stay long enough to really enjoy the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Original Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller27
Reviews.Content: I can't stop gushing about this hotel! Not only is the property first rate but the service was excellent as well. The historic Beaux Arts building has been meticulously restored and renovated (think Restoration Hardware all the way). The rooms evoke the era of when travel was exotic and luxurious! The "steamer trunk" dresser and other details are wonderful. Rooms and bathrooms are spacious; the desk has ample workspace and is stocked with the basic office supplies. The manager called the room a few minutes after I had checked in to confirm that everything was to my liking. The only negative is the small, slow elevator (it looks like it is historic) and the charge for wireless access (waived for elite HiltonHonors members). Can't wait to return to Seattle and the Arctic Club!

Reviews.Title: “A great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: daggern
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here. We were on a short break from victoria and we have stayed in several hotels in seattle before but this was by far the best. The rooms are all themed as if you were travelling in the 1800s but are a great size. The bar and the Food are excellent and the hotel is close to downtown and a 5 minute walk to pike place we will definatley stay there again

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely, Historic Property”
Reviews.Author: DesertExec
Reviews.Content: First the down side. It's located several blocks off the beaten path in downtown and close to what is a changing area somewhat fraught with urban challenges. Get used to frequent police sirens and ambulences sent to pick up stabbing victims a few blocks away. Most of the crime is related to homelessness, poverty and alcohol and drug use and not aimed at tourists or residents. Seattle has always had a plethora of Native America, African-American and other street people. The economy isn't helping. So, with that out of the way, let me state that this is a lovely, well-maintained property. The building's history is fascinating, as are some of the decor items used throughout that were part of the original property. Front desk, valet and room service staff were, for the most part, professional, warm and responsive. Rooms are varied in layout, but well appointed and extremely comfortable. Nice big bathrooms make up for somewhat smaller rooms, but it makes for a very nice stay. The main part of downtown is a pleasant 10 minute walk away, along with Pikes Place and other tourist areas. Seattle is a great walking city so take advantage of it. Your body will thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with a "Boutique" feel.”
Reviews.Author: SEAORF
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fantastic hotel. Rooms had character, were clean, and the service was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Classic”
Reviews.Author: Jazzierose1
Reviews.Content: The room was lovely but needed more lighting and vents. Would have been nice if you could open the windows just a bit to get some fresh air!

Reviews.Title: “The only place in downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: mtngirlnv
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights and these people are fabulous. From the moment I pulled up, they took great care of me. Traveling alone isn't always easy, but the staff here at the Arctic Club went out of their way to make sure I was comfortable. The valet knew my name by the second day, and my car was out and ready within five minutes every time. The Juno restaurant has an excellent small menu and nice wine list. The rooms are small, but well appointed and clean. I would give this place six stars if possible. Transportation is also a great asset for this hotel. Third Street has buses that run down to the downtown shopping area for no charge, and it's an easy walk to Pioneer Square as well. Lots of other restaurants within two blocks, and the concierge is always happy to recommend something specific.

Reviews.Title: “How Can You Not Love A Hotel That Has Walruses on the Facade?”
Reviews.Author: kdh1716
Reviews.Content: Located on Pioneer Square, steps from the light rail station, this is a wonderful hotel in a beautifully restored building. The hotel tries to catch the ambiance of early twentieth century Seattle without sacrificing modern convenience. The rooms are spacious and beautifully appointed. The staff is well trained, considerate and professional. Take a moment to visit the dome room with its leaded glass ceiling or just wander around the lobby looking at the souvenirs from Seattle's past. Connections to the airport through the light rail line are convenient and the hotel is in easy walking distance of museums and the public library. The famous fish market is a bit longer walk but is still easily done.

Reviews.Title: “Classic and Lovely”
Reviews.Author: ild
Reviews.Content: Located in a beautifully restored classic building this is a gem worth visiting. Of course, in a 100 year old building ADA access is not a forte; the main entrance off Cherry Street is a set of steep stairs off a sloping sidewalk. Once inside, the lobby is home to a gracious and spacious Polar Bar Lounge. Our room was a corner jacuzzi that was roomy and comfortable. The closet was a nice size but dark enough to require a flashlight to find anything. Bonus points for an actual tea kettle; especially nice for us tea drinkers who don't appreciate making tea with coffee tainted water. The HVAC is noisy but the room temperature can be maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Decor', ambience, the amenities..”
Reviews.Author: JosephGaied
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room decor, amenities, accommodations. Hotel is centrally located in Downtown Seattle, making my travel across the city using public transportation a breeze. Staff is very friendly. I was greeted with a nice cookie, and the front desk called me to make sure that all is OK, about 15 minutes after i got to the room. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: eabareno
Reviews.Content: They don't build them like this anymore. We never heard our next door neighbors, not a TV set or toilet flushing, and we loved the quiet. While there is outdoor traffic noise and we are not city dwellers, it sounded like white noise to us. The location was fantastic, adjacent to all public transportation, including the underground transit just across the street. We were one free stop away from the International District and the King Street Amtrak Station, and we had quick and free access to downtown in the other direction. We could walk to Pioneer Square, and to the waterfront and the ferry to Bainbridge Island. There were many inexpensive restaurants in the vicinity. The library is two blocks to the north and a great source of free wifi (the hotel charges for wifi). While our room was small, it was very comfortable, especially the bed. There was an in-room safe big enough to hold my laptop, free Washington State apples and chocolate chip cookies at the front desk, and helpful concierge and front desk service that gracefully answered my tourist type questions.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, hotel.... rooms are small!”
Reviews.Author: TravelorSLC
Reviews.Content: Hotel is just ok! The rooms are small and not in the best location. Also if you you forget your cell phone charger, they will steel it and say it was never in the room! Do not stay here, unless you want a small rooms for a large price!

Reviews.Title: “ROMANTIC & CLASSY!”
Reviews.Author: ARIZONAULI
Reviews.Content: This is such a nice, clean and historically rich hotel! The rooms are very comfortable, bathrooms are nice and clean. The staff is friendly, the bar area with pooltable and fireplace a great spot to either start your night or let it wind down. The hotel is conveniently located in downtown Seattle and walking distance to many attractions. I highly recommand the hotel and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very comfortable rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: chgotrvlr71
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after attending a conference at another hotel downtown but wanting to extend my stay through the weekend. The hotel was very cozy with helpful staff. My room was very comfortable corner room and a nice comfy king bed and nice bathroom. Others have commented on the hotel being noisy but even with windows overlooking the street and a huge gala going on in the hotel during my stay, I never heard anything the entire stay. The rooms were a tad small, lots of bumping into one another for two people in the room but that is typically the case in older, historic hotels. Great walking distance to everything -- Pioneer Square, Market, the stadiums....will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: bostona
Reviews.Content: Right on the edge of downtown, within walking distance of all shops and restaurants and also the Mariners and Seahawks stadiums, I was met by the nicest people you'll ever meet at the front desk. As it was 9am and my room was not ready, they gave two of the famous Doubletree chocolate chip cookies (now warm!) and went out of their way to be helpful. The hotel has a 1930 touch, very classy and stylish. Room was great, HD tv (to make it makes a huge difference, even if I might not watch it for a long time), spacious bathroom, minibar, all the amenites you might need. They also feature a car service to the airport for 40$ (Sea-Tac is not near downtown), less than I paid the cab that got me there. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Artic Club DoubleTree Downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: WICK9
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel. We stayed on the 2nd floor which was the main floor. The room was at the end of the hallway. Upon entering it I was amazed at the size. It was a nice large room with a king bed. Bathroom had a large soaking tub. The ceiling was about 20ft high which made it seem so spacious. I really enjoyed the room and hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: hotlanta2
Reviews.Content: Front desk told me they had a beautiful QUIET room for me. I guess I should know that when they say that they mean sorry we dont have an upgrade for you and this is all we have. Room w/ sofabed was very small and historic quality only vaguely quaint. Unfortunalty, it was so noisy (I could hear the conversations from the parking lot and I was on the 5th floor) I thought a window was open, but not the case. So, I had to move to a smaller room (as i said, nothing else available even for a diamond HHonors member) and paid the same amount for the cheaper room which also was not acceptable. So, my 4 night stay turned into a 1 night stay. The restaurant for breakfast was good allowing ordering from general menu with good service. Also, I wound up finding this hotel really out of the way if you'll be spending your time in downtown and near Pike's market. And, the fringe location did not result in a quieter location.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: 192Alyssa
Reviews.Content: Wait at the valet, wait over an hour past check in to get to room, unsympathetic staff. I stayed here on a Saturday night, so perhaps their A team was away.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kate0709
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an a great location (right off the light rail line from the airport), the room was lovely, new and very quiet (never heard another guest in the hallway), the lobby is gorgeous with a beautiful bar. The staff were super friendly and laid-back. They were all too happy to answer questions and give directions. They even offered us complimentary chocolate strawberries and champagne because they knew we were celebrating our anniversary. We were unable to partake, but it was a really nice touch. We were so busy exploring the city, we never got a chance to check out the pool and gym. Will go back in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable downtown Seattle hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4familytravelers66
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is not the most family-friendly we have enjoyed, the room was comfortable enough with nice linens, towels, plush bathrobes and a good view. We found the hotel to be very quiet also which allowed for great sleeping. It was a bit cramped for the four of us, but we survived. The hotel was undergoing some renovation while we were there and great care seemed to be taken so as not to inconvenience guests. We enjoyed the convenient downtown location of this hotel making many attractions within a nice walking distance for us. The staff was very accommodating as well. There is a very nice bar located just off the registration desk which looked like a great place to have a cocktail and recount the days' activities.

Reviews.Title: “Charm, service and comfort in downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: DeanpW
Reviews.Content: The Arctic Club combines the charm of a renovated century-old building, warm service and very comfortable rooms into an appealing, somewhat quirky hotel. The valet and front desk staff greeted us warmly and the check-in and check-out processes were quick and efficient. Rooms are elegant, with high ceilings, moldings and great bathrooms. A real plus is the Polar Bar, where the bartender makes a perfect martini. It's a quick walk to McCormick's Fish House, a fine seafood restaurant. This end of downtown is a bit deserted at night, but it's very convenient to Safeco Field and light rail transit to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: Bagehot_11
Reviews.Content: The staff was great. The room was very comfortable. The staff was very, very helpful and attentive. I enjoyed the Polar Bar and its very professional bartender, Viktor. It was a great hotel experience and a great historical experience as well. I felt like I had stepped back in time to a more elegant era. This wasn't like most Doubletrees I've stayed at (which have been just fine), this was a real "experience." The location in downtown Seattle was unbeatable. You can walk to anywhere; the train station is just a few blocks away, and light-rail to Sea-Tac airport just a block away. The waterfront is three blocks away, there are two Irish bars close by, shopping is five blocks away, and Pike Street Market a nice walk.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Helpful and Charming Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: PlacesT0See
Reviews.Content: A lovely place to stay. The room was somewhat small, and the washroom configuration somewhat awkward however the furnishings were lovely and very comfortable. The hotel is located far enough away from the tourist attractions like Pike place but still convenient to them and the heritage area and the stadium. Very easy to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Carrie L
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful experience at this hotel. The service was outstanding from every employee at this hotel. The rooms were on the smaller side, but they were antique looking and the beds were so comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best bar on the west coast hands down”
Reviews.Author: Immergeil
Reviews.Content: The Polar Bar, on the other hand, is one of the best bars we've encountered in a long while. I believe most of this (if not all of it) is due to Viktor the bartender. Viktor is attentive, friendly, helpful, and a wealth of knowledge relating to the Arctic Club hotel. His drinks are delicious and well served. If you like Absynthe, Viktor will put on a show! Don't forget to view the Ballroom ceiling on the 3rd floor! We look forward to returning to Seattle and to our new favorite hotel, the Arctic Club and favorite bar and bartender!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: karen4352
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. The room was spacious and nicely decorated. The bathroom was large with a whirlpool tub and a large vanity. The hotel doesn’t offer free WiFi in your room but if you are a silver or higher Honors member they’ll waive the in room fee. Make sure you ask for it… it wasn’t offered to me at check in. The staff was hit or miss. The parking attendants are SLOW to get your car, if they are even in the valet area. More than once we had to come back because they were nowhere to be seen. When we pulled up for check in, we had to lug our luggage up the front steps. The bellmen didn’t come out to offer to help us. Only once we were in the front door did they offer to help us with our bags. At that point we could get them to our room so we declined the offer. At check in, the hotel did allow us to check in early (noon) but put us on the 4th floor (421). We asked for a higher floor but they told us we would have to wait to check in until 4:00 and they couldn’t tell us if we could get a higher floor until then. I don’t buy that… they know who is checking in and out every day. So we took the room. I thought the front desk woman could’ve been more helpful. She wasn’t rude but she also wasn’t warm and welcoming. There were times where the staff was helpful. Especially when asking about places to eat for dinner. They made reservations for us and called us cabs. As I said before, the room was beautiful but the street noise was loud. We ate lunch at Juno’s the first day. There were 3 of us and our tab was $70 before tip! That was for sandwiches and one beer each. Needless to say, we only ate there once. The food was really good… just not $70 good. The location was good. An easy walk to Pikes Place, only about 10 minutes. It is located right outside the train to the airport so DON’T rent a car unless you have to. Parking is $39 (including tax) per night. Cabs are not expensive and easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with a lot of character in downtown seattle”
Reviews.Author: Britt B
Reviews.Content: Great, unique hotel with a lot of character. Very tall ceilings everywhere, with rich oak walls in the lobby, reception, halls, and room which was very regal and rich looking. Fantastic bathroom - one of the nicest we've been in. Bedding was very comfortable. They gave us slippers to keep, had free newspapers to take, service was good (very helpful). Only drawbacks are that you have to valet park your car and if you don't get the right room it can seem a bit darka nd gloomy (my husband didn't mind this at all but I prefer lighter warmer rooms). Great that you could use the internet for free in the lobby. This hotel is on the historic registry of hotels which was nice to say we've stayed in! Walking distance to some great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: malawimike
Reviews.Content: Nothing negative to report. Staff was nothing less than professional and helpful (and friendly!). The hotel is beautifully restored. Ask for the sheet of paper that gives the history of the building, and explore. Great marble staircases, but they are hidden behind stairwell doors so few people probably ever see them! The location is good too -- close to some local government offices, pioneer square, easy walk to pike market, plus the free downtown buses stop right outside the hotel. All in all, I give high marks to this hotel. See pics of my room...

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice if You Have the Right Room”
Reviews.Author: islandjule
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in late September. PROS: Good location, easy walking distance to public transportation, waterfront or Pioneer Square and cool retro vibe as it is restored gentleman's club. CONS: Dark, as in gloomy dark. Closet had no light and room lighting was not adequate; Paid for "upgraded" corner suite (Rm #601, $215 per nt) - had gorgeous view of parking lot on one side, and demolished building site on the other. Valet parking is $32 per nt w/o taxes. Told by valets that the next door parking lot suffered from frequent "vandalism" so was hesitant to "self park" (maybe that was just the party line?). Entire bar area shut down from 4 PM - 9 PM on Saturday for a private party. We looked forward to spending our last night with a drink at the historic Polar Ice bar - but, was not in our future. Would have been nice to know that this was going to happen (maybe a sign put up earlier in day?). Street noise is loud as well as on-site functions (wedding on-site rocked until wee hours - even on 6th floor I felt like I was there doing the 'lectric slide at midnight.) Suggestion: Ask for room facing 3rd Ave. Rooms facing Cherry and 4th Ave have the worst view. See my pix.

Reviews.Title: “Problems with service, signage”
Reviews.Author: pattayainsider
Reviews.Content: The room was fine, but I had all kinds of problems with service. It started with trying to find the hotel. Their street address is one one street, but their actual entry is on the side street. It's all one way streets, and in rush hour traffic, trying to navigate to find their entry, took almost 40 minutes to literally just end up going around the block. And at their street address street, there is an entrance, but not for valet parking. And there is only a tiny sign, maybe two inches long that says something like "ring for service". I only saw the sign when the manager showed it to me. Their entrance for valet is on a very very steep street, and it's quite scary to get in and out, and park there waiting for a valet to show up. There were three separate instances where I was either overcharged, or a promised credit wasn't delivered. When I complained about this, the manager told me, "you've been nothing but trouble since you arrived here". Outside of these problems, the room and hotel were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great old hotel”
Reviews.Author: TN-Bill
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed here over a weekend in August 2011. I did use HHonors points, but I think I would have payed to stay here as well. The location is good, pretty close to most everything in downtown Seattle, and what is not close you can generally use the free downtown transportation to get there (like to Pike Market). Down the hill toward the water are bars and restaurants. Plus it is right next to a light rail stop that takes you right to SeaTac airport. The room was awesome - large and very cool. There was a neat glass door going into the bathroom. The bed was very comfortable. About the only issues were a bit of street noise and if you go left (south) out of the hotel you run into a not-so-great area. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great central location”
Reviews.Author: s2npdx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Arctic club the night before going to the Seahawks/Cardinals game. It is in a good central location..close to the waterfront and close to the stadiums. We were greeted and had our car parked and at noon, our room was ready. So we were able to get settled before heading down to the waterfront for lunch and some sightseeing. The place has an older smell, but was clean and comfortable. The Polar bar was a nice spot to have a couple of drinks after dinner. It has some good drinks options and very professional bartender. The hotel allowed us to keep our car parked in their valet lot until the game was over at 4:30 pm. Overall, we very much our stay at the Arctic club and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again on a return trip to Seattle

Reviews.Title: “Very honest and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: JTSF
Reviews.Content: I have always genuinely found this hotel to be very pleasant, but I wanted to share a special experience to commend their staff: I accidentally left a very expensive suit in the closet in my room. I didn't immediately realize it and when I called the hotel several months later thinking it was a very lost cause, they still had my suit in lost and found! They fed-exed it to me right away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay when in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: FredSG
Reviews.Content: If arriving by airplane the hotel is conveniently located across the road from the Pioneer Square Skytrain stop. Costs a lot less than taxi or shuttle. Worth considering depending on the amount of luggage you have. The steep hill makes carrying bags to the front door on Cherry St a problem, but there is an alternate entrance on 3rd Avenue. Seattle is a hilly city. The location of the hotel was several blocks away from the main tourist areas, such as Pike Markets and the waterfront. This meant a bit of walking but it was pleasant nevertheless. A free city bus is also available. Bell hop and concierge service varied depending on who was on duty at the time. Overall they were OK. They assisted us with instructions about getting around Seattle and had good local knowledge. The warm cookies on arrival were a nice treat. Check-in was friendly and efficient. The room, like the hotel public areas, were themed to look and feel like a Gentleman Explorer's club. It was well done. The room was large, with a separate room for a desk. It was beautifully maintained and the fittings were good quality. The bed very comfortable and the room was very quiet. Breakfast was nice in the hotel's restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “I Should Have Choose a Different Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frances N
Reviews.Content: Even though their web site shows bell hops waiting at the 700 3rd Ave entrance, there are none there. This is where the taxi cabs let you off and then you struggle with your luggage to get it into the building and then find that you must take an elevator to the 2nd floor for the lobby. Once you get to the 2nd floor, you must again struggle with your luggage to get to the check-in area where there are bell hops just waiting around at the Cherry Street entrance. What is wrong with this picture??? The street noise at night is loud but luckily I had brought my Brookstone Sound Therapy System with me. I think limos are the only form of transportation that drops you off and picks you up at the Cherry Street entrance. I took a limo back to the airport and it really was not any more expensive than a taxi and well worth every penny. I found the food at the Juno Restaurant to be very good. I now wish I would have picked Hotel Monaco for my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and comfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: goobienme
Reviews.Content: When we planned our trip to Seattle I was 8 mo pregnant so comfortable beds were a must! This place not only has comfortable beds but excellent service!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff... great hotel”
Reviews.Author: egldrvr555
Reviews.Content: We only had a limited time at this charming hotel, but every moment was a pleasure. The room was fantastic and the front desk staff exceptionally accommodating. Especially noteworthy was the front desk manager, Ms Anna Kim, who made our stay as best it could be. The hotel's location is great for connecting to SeaTac -- the light rail is right across the street -- and everything's an easy walking distance in downtown Seattle. When we go back to Seattle again, we'll be staying here... and for much longer!

Reviews.Title: “Historic”
Reviews.Author: smoothoney
Reviews.Content: I have to say the charm of this hotel blew me away. The building was an old gentelmens club, that has been preserved and restored. The rooms although small make up for it with days gone by charm with modern amenities. The blue room doors were a hit with me. Its close to pike market, and we didn't need to rent a car. Seattle has a great public transportation system. The gem of the hotel was Angelo the bellman he was our go to guy. He really took care of us, and answered all our questions. Now, I did find a tank top behind the end table, when my watch fell. Honestly it would have been easy to miss. I had to move it to reach all the way beihind it. This in no way effects my opionion on the hotel. If you dont want the cookie cutter hotel. I highly recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Old Hotel, Especially for a chain”
Reviews.Author: Rossjz
Reviews.Content: The staff was great. Our rooms were updated and large. Everyone was really nice. I would recommend this place. The area is quiet at night, I think because it is the financial district.

Reviews.Title: “Unique historical building, good location”
Reviews.Author: loves2garden
Reviews.Content: Don't miss seeing the amazing ceiling in the ballroom for a look back at the gold rush era! Breakfast in the downstairs restaurant was very nice and a great way to start the day. I liked the place, the location was convenient, but the only draw-back was the noisy street. I asked for a quiet room, and was provided with ear plugs. They didn't help that much.

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel right in the city”
Reviews.Author: Dallashawkeye
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Arctic Club in Seattle. First, the location is top notch, netled right between two big attractions - Pioneer Square and Pike's market. Pike's market is approx 8 blocks away, but an easy walk. Pioneer square is approx 2 block away. The service was great. Although this is a Hilton family hotel (and you'll get your Hilton Points), you would never know it was a chain hotel. The interior is decorated with pictures of old Arctic Club members, the rooms feel like you are about to take an expedition to Alaska. Really a fun stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - One of the best stays I've ever Had”
Reviews.Author: FlyingHigh060
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just charming. The lobby is interesting - as is the collection of top hats. The "Arctic Club" theme is very cute and carried out throughout the hotel. I have status with Hilton and we were upgraded to a VERY NICE Suite on the top floor which had a balcony. While the downstairs area has old-world charm, the rooms are new and beautiful. The bed was super comfy! The hotel is in a great location for sight-seeing and enjoying everything Seattle has to offer. The Staff were exceedingly helpful and I could not have enjoyed my stay more. (1 bias to add is that I love the double-tree chocolate chip cookies).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: VickyE2006
Reviews.Content: This hotel really has service nailed. The room was spacious and the bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel one of my favorites in washington”
Reviews.Author: eric p
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this location multiple nights last year and wanted to write and let everyone know that it was a great hotel. I travel a decent amount and would highly recomend this hotel. The only reason i am not giving the hotel 5 stars is that the fire alarm went of twice while i was staying there. The front desk staff and houskeeping were great.

Reviews.Title: “Juno Restaurant is over priced and the food is terrible.”
Reviews.Author: Ron C
Reviews.Content: When checking in we were encouraged to try Juno, the restaurant associated with the hotel. Our initial plan was to try a local seafood restaurant because of Seattle's reputation for great seafood. Since the restaurant was recommended to us we thought we would give it a try, big mistake. The restaurant is conveniently located next to the hotel but that was all it had going for it. After glancing at the menu we realized the restaurant was going to be an expensive proposition for the 4 of us. A full meal was in the $30 to $40 range per person, which is a reasonable price for a good seafood restaurant. Unfortunately the appetizers were disappointing (ceasar salad dripping with bad Kraft like dressing) and the seafood plates we ordered were over cooked and salty. When a restaurant charges the prices Juno does a customer should expect a level of service and food commensurate with the price. Unfortunately Juno failed to deliver in most respects. After a delay in our check-in our room in the hotel was large and very nice. The room was on the 1st floor with large picture windows. The decor was very pleasant and the Starbucks coffee was appreciated in the mornings. We did find the room noisy late at night when the party goers returned too the hotel after a late night of drinking. Otherwise our stay was pleasant and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: hugbandit7
Reviews.Content: I always try and read reviews and look at picitures and I wasn't 100% sure about this property but the price was right. Plus it was a Hilton Hotel, surely it couldn't be that bad? Check in went very smoothly, in fact we arrived early and our room was ready unlike our friends that arrived before us and didn't get their room until hours later (but to the hotel's credit our friends had a nice room on the top floor so I'm sure someone else had to vacate the room first). The room was on the 6th floor (I believe) and it was a corner room. There was a little sitting area at the end of the bed and a huge bathroom. The hotel probably could have eliminated a chair to make a little more space, but it all fit well. The hotel was located in a good part of town that made it easy to walk around town and see the site. Across the street was a little cafe that serves a yummy breakfast sandwich. I don't really recommend the restaurant in the hotel, especially not for breakfast. The food was fine but it was way overpriced for what you get. Unfortunately the cafe across the street wasn't open on a Sunday morning. We stayed here for 2 nights before our cruise and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.....taxis are a problem”
Reviews.Author: hbhakh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Arctic Club for one night prior to flying home from Seattle. It’s an old building that has been renovated into a hotel. We thought the décor was well done and reflected the history of the building. Our corner room was comfortable and spacious. The complimentary breakfast (Hhonors gold) was in the hotel restaurant and was very good. The location is a little out of the way for some downtown attractions but most are still walk able. My only complaint was the lack of available taxis. The bell staff pushed a limo company that is more expensive to the airport than taxi service. It tool over 30 minutes for us to get a taxi, which I find unacceptable for a downtown hotel that advertises as four stars.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in Every Aspect”
Reviews.Author: HB_and_CE
Reviews.Content: We are Hilton Honors members and used our points to stay at this hotel-it was worth it! The check-in staff was professional, helpful, and friendly. There was staff everywhere to help. The room was not only clean, but well-decorated and comfortable. Also, the bed was comfortable, a/c worked well, and there was no noise from the city nor neighboring rooms. We can't say enough good things about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: letsgosoon123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way to and from Victoria. The hotel itself is an historic building that used to be a men's club, and Hilton has kept the ambiance and history of the original building intact after the renovation and restoration (restored in 2009, I believe). Our concierge, Stephen, was simply the best I have ever come in contact with, and gave us tips on sights and neighborhoods in Seattle and Victoria that enhanced our trip greatly. The rooms were slightly on the small side, but immaculate and well appointed with a very comfortable bed. Every member of the staff we encountered was absolutely professional and courteous at all times - really representative of a five star hotel. Any downsides were not the fault of the hotel. The Pioneer Square neighborhood is in transition, but this hotel will be an anchor in the transformation. Street noise was an issue because of the hundreds of millions of buses that run through Seattle. The upside to this is that the hotel is literally across the street from the Pioneer Square light rail stop (40 minutes to or from the airport, $2.75 each way and HIGHLY recommended), and is also right next to a major bus stop, which makes travel through the city easy. It is also about a 15 minute walk to the famous Public Market, 20 or so to restaurants on the waterfront, definitely a cab ride to the Victoria Clipper ferry service. All in all, highly recommended, with the caveat that a room away from the street is better than one next to the street.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, dont get room facing street!”
Reviews.Author: europeantraveler1953
Reviews.Content: stayed here before our alaska cruise.we knew nothing about seattle,so my sister used her points for this hotel.location fine but id say more of business hotel..reason,in the middle of buildings and gets noisey early as folks are going to work or where ever.actually heard yelling early in the morning several times in the 7 am hour.street car right outside our window not only makes a bit of light coming in,but very noisey.when we asked about it they said streetcars stop around 8.not true.stayed noisey most of the night.all else was fine,clean nice hotel.id say stay on the water at the marriott with the great view in the middle of it all and right by the ships!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: cblack201
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Arctic Club in Seattle. Super easy to get to from Seatac.Service was wonderful and the free bus route makes Downtown a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Remodel, Great Location for Walking to Safeco Field”
Reviews.Author: nnl
Reviews.Content: My son, husband and I just returned from a one night stay at this charming Hilton Hotel. We were in Seattle to attend a Friday night Mariner vs. Red Sox game and this was our first time staying at The Arctic Club. We usually stay at the Inn at Harbor Steps, a B&B, but it was full so we found the Arctic Club and we loved it! So many things to comment on: Pros: Warm cookies at check-in (!); friendly bell men, front desk people and valet (he spoke french with my son); walking distance to both Century Link and Safeco Fields; decor is old world and stately; beds/pillows are comfortable; room size was adequate and well laid out (we had a room with 2 queen beds); bathroom was spacious and well lit with tile floors, make-up mirror, Crabtree & Evelyn amenities, marble top counter; well stocked mini bar on the honor system; overall ambiance was pleasant and relaxing! Cons: Only 2 elevators and they are rather small; valet parking is $32.00 a day but with taxes it came to $39.04 (more than I paid in Waikiki last month!); hotel restaurant Juno which I will review separately; 4 pm check-in. We got to the hotel at 3:10 pm and had to wait until 4 to get our room assignment. Next time we will spend a weekend at The Arctic Club and hopefully have more to comment on. There is a business center and fitness room at this hotel but I did not have time to check out either one. There is also a public parking lot next door to the hotel which might be less expensive than the valet service.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from downtown. Neat building”
Reviews.Author: wilco501
Reviews.Content: We needed a room for our family (2 small kids) for one night. I used to live in WA, so was familiar with area, butthis is a newer hotel. Seafair was going on and rooms were a little tight in town. I got a room at this hotel through hotwire at a decent price, having used priceline and hotwire many times in past. So we show up after a long day of travelling at about 9:30 and instantly upon check in the guy working at the desk days " i see you booked your room through a third party site". I said yes. He said, well we cant accomodate you with 2 beds. Kind of haughty about it as well. Actually, on hotwire you can request accomodations for 4 people, and we did it at the sheraton thefollowing week. They ( sheraton) automatically had us in a double room without asking. So with "nothing else available" we had a room with a pullout sofa. It was fine but you couldnt really move around. Otherwise, the bar area was cool--absinthe! Sirens all night long was unpleasant. Restaurant juno for breakfast was ok albeit slow service. I wouldnt stay here again, too many better options around.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Bliss”
Reviews.Author: beautea97
Reviews.Content: Son & Daughter-in-Law chose this venue for their wedding and it was a BRILLAINT choice!!! From the time we checked in until check-out every wish was granted. Daily fresh fruit in the lobby and very helpful front desk employees! This is a PERFECT venue for a wedding... Wedding/Reception in one location and a place for out-of-towners to overnight! PLUS the location downtown is awesome!!! There is a light rail stop (guests can board at Sea-Tac) nearly at the entrance!! This made transporatation a breeze :-) Bellman were MORE than helpful with guests luggage in addition to the bridal parties additional needs. Highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in historic Arctic Club - restored and wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: nylady21
Reviews.Content: My family LOVED this hotel! We had two connecting rooms which gave us plenty of space for two teens and two adults. The bathrooms are amazing, including the beautiful doors. The Polar Bar in the lobby serves great drinks in an old-time 'club' atmosphere. The restaurant, Juno, had fabulous breakfasts. Service at the front desk was friendly and knowledgeable. The hotel is a few block walk to the Retail Core, but was right next to the exit from the Pioneer Square station for the LightRail link from the airport. We truly didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: N_and_R
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at DoubleTree Arctic Club Hotel in Seattle before and after our Alaska cruise. This was our first time visiting Seattle. The location was perfect. The hotel staff were very professional and helpful. The rooms are very well decorated (very masculine). I would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for weddings, location not great!”
Reviews.Author: mlabberton
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Arctic Club and found the accomodations fine (refurbished men's club), the staff very friendly, and the wedding venue...i.e. lobby bar and ballroom truly perfect for a large reception. Our rooms were off the hall from the ballroom, so that was super convenient. Our only problem with the hotel was that it is located too far from the heart of Seattle shopping and dining. It would be great for a Seahawk football, Mariner's baseball or Sounders soccer, because it's close to the stadiums in Pioneer Square, but it's a long hike up to Pike Place Market, Pacific Place, the Seattle Convention Center, and of course, the Nordstrom flagship store. The neighborhood is definitely transitional and can get a bit seedy; however, once inside this fascinating, converted explorer's club of the 1900s...it's great.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: Siamesefish2497
Reviews.Content: Very cool hotel! From the pictures on the walls to the warm cookies upon arrival this hotel is very inviting. The room we stayed in was a little small. But the ambiance more than made up for it. The location is within walking distance of pike place market. But is also located on some very steep hills. Bring some walking shoes!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: noonanagain
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over 4th weekend. Wonderful staff--very attentive. Paid for the valet parking and they did not even blink at the condition of my car (4 day road trip). They even went back to the car later for some dvd's we forgot--don't know how in the world they found them! Comfortable beds/pillows. Very clean.

Reviews.Title: “My new Seattle hotel!”
Reviews.Author: goodnorthern
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, service, and restored historic hotel. What a treat! A little loud but well worth it. Skip the car and take the metro to downtown from the airport. Loved every minute!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful historic hotel reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: replay49
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to stay here during a weekend getaway, and were very pleased with the accomodations. This is a great old historic Seattle building that has been wonderfully restored and in a very convenient location close to Pioneer Square and an easy walk to the ball stadiums and Pike Place Market. The staff were all friendly and helpful and the room amenities were great....french press Starbucks coffee with enough for several cups, comfortable bedding, plush robes, flat screen t.v., and quality toiletries. Other than a little bit of street noise, it was very quiet at night. There's a very nice old high ceilinged lobby with the Polar Bar adjacent. It made us feel like we had stepped back in time. The Polar Bar was a real bar with a bartender who was a true mixicologist. The Arctic Club is a quality hotel, conveniently located, and reasonably priced. We'll definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “great place in downtown seattle”
Reviews.Author: Bert0504
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel downtown. My family and I had a great stay at the Arctic Club. It is located several blocks from Pike and Pine but it is easy to get there day or evening. The staff doesn't give advice unless you ask for it. But the rooms and the hotel are great.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: hawa
Reviews.Content: The Arctic Club is a lovely hotel close to Pioneer Square. What makes this an excellent choice is its location near the Pioneer Station of the rail link from Sea-Tac airport. It is a half block walk and barely uphill. The hotel atmosphere is like a private club with a comfortable lobby and bar area. The rooms are on the small side but are comfortably furnished and well maintained. The hotel is located on Third Avenue with easy access to bus transportation and a manageable walk to restaurants and Pike Place market. We enjoyed staying here, especially for its convenience and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but parking is way too expensive”
Reviews.Author: jefinNova
Reviews.Content: stayed there for one night on July 4. First of all, let me tell you that no one should spend the 4th of July in Seattle if you expect to have any fun other than watching the fireworks. Most restaurants and bars were closed. We are from the DC area and were very surprised. We did find a restaurant by the waterfront and a few bars but the majority were closed. As for the hotel, it was nice. Clean rooms, good service, good location but the parking is way too expensive (I think $30+). We tried to find a parking garage close by but of course.....yes, they were closed too. It felt like a ghost town around the hotel because of the holiday.

Reviews.Title: “great choice”
Reviews.Author: phillie15
Reviews.Content: 1/4 block from the light rail connection to seatac airport, with great public transportation from hotel to whole area. the hotel is awesome, very comfortable historic building right in the middle of things to do in seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Something Different from the Standard Hotels”
Reviews.Author: CZSandy
Reviews.Content: We decided on this hotel for our one night pre-cruise stay and were totally pleased. The lobby area isn't anything special so as we checked in, I was a bit worried how the room would be. Not to worry!! It was absolutely delightful. The decoration and the furnishings were a pleasant change from the standard hotels we're used to. The bed was wonderful and the french press coffee pot was special. We used the light rail from the airport. You get off just a few steps from the lower entrance to the hotel. That's a deal too ....75 cents for seniors. The free buses stop in front of the hotel and we took every advantage of that. The desk clerks were very helpful mapping out the places we wanted to go and how to get there. They arranged a town car to get 4 of us with luggage to Pier 91 for $25. A taxi is probably a little bit cheaper. If you're looking for something a little different with the same amenities as the other upscale hotels, you'll definitely want to consider this one.

Reviews.Title: “Arctic Club was warm and inviting!”
Reviews.Author: Stilldiane
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Seattle for three nights the second week of July. We choose Arctic Club over some other hotels we had researched and boy are we glad we did! Everything was great from the ability to get into our room early, the delicious warm cookies. Chipo, the Front Desk Clerk was very kind and helpful. She told us about some of the restaurants close by and how to use the transit which was across the street and down one level. The waterfront, Pike's Place were within walking distance. We would walk back and forth a few times a day from the hotel. We used the underground bus to get to the shopping area. The room itself was so nice I loved lobby/bar area. The rooms are decorated in an upscale 40s motif. It was a very romantic weekend and we will be back;)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: otownvagabond
Reviews.Content: This hotel got it right. Wonderful historic building, interesting and tasteful decor, comfy beds, lots of extra little touches to meet your every need (like q-tips and cotton balls in the bathroom), plush robes, great location-it's exactly what I hope to find in a boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Classy with a slightly creepy lobby”
Reviews.Author: Lael_Lael
Reviews.Content: I never quite got over the lobby walls plastered with early 20th Century black and white photographs of the solemn members of the social club that the building once housed (presumably the Arctic Club). Check in was a breeze and we were given delicious chocolate chip cookies and room keys that didn't quite work, but they noticed the mistake and delivered the correct keys before we had even turned around. Our room was on the lobby level and featured a huge loft space occupied by a bunch of duct work and such. The decor is classy, eclectic vaguely nautical reminiscent of the mens club the building once housed. The furnishings are mostly deco or revival style. I was very impressed with the ipod dock stereo system... possibly the most high tech hotel room I have encountered. The lobby bar has a pool table, although it's a bit difficult to play on. The location is excellent if you want to go to Pioneer Square but a little bit further South than most comparable hotels. We were less than thrilled with the miniature jacuzzi tub... but then I guess that's why it only cost $10 more for the upgrade! The mini bar isn't the weighted sensor kind, which is nice, and it has an actual physical key. The TVs are very nice and they offer relatively high quality (albeit pricey: $39.00 for noon to noon access) adult programming.

Reviews.Title: “Old Gentleman's club...loved the ambiance!”
Reviews.Author: drenTexas
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Artic Club Seattle 1 night before our Alaskan cruise...had 3 rooms for 9 of us. Very interesting story of it being an old Gentlemen's club...loved the fireplace in the lobby with pool table and bar. The building is old but tastefully decorated. The elevators were very small but the room was very spacious and comfy..expecially the bed! Room service was prompt. You had to use the room key to operate the elevator to get to our room..added security. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. They arranged transportation for all 9 of us in a van to get to the pier. A few blocks from the wharf area, which we walked to and ate at Ivar's (best clam chowder I have ever eaten!). Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Before a Cruise”
Reviews.Author: lvcruzers
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night before our Alaska cruise. This was a wonderful hotel. The staff at the front desk were very friendly & tried to find us a room close to our friends. We had a queen size bed that was extremely comfortable. The location was right on 3rd Street, a great location. Seattle has a free bus system that runs right down 3rd Street. You can catch the bus to go on the Underground tour or catch the bus in the other direction to go to the Space Needle & Pikes Market. When we arrived we walked over one block & down to the water (3 blks) & caught the ferry to see Seattle at night. (Note: when the ferry drops you off at the island, it makes everyone get off. We had to wait about 30 min. to reboard the ferry for the return trip. Nothing is open on the island at night). We booked another hotel for our stay when our cruise was over & wished that we had rebooked this one. Only 2 very small complaints...1) We were there on the weekend so a lot of businesses were closed. They cater to the downtown crowd on the weekdays. We ended up eating at the hotel which had very good food. 2) We asked the front desk where a place to get a 6 pack of Diet Pepsi was. They sent us up a very steep hill about 8 - 10 blocks after our hike we looked down the street to the next block & there was a small store. We also found a Walgreens about 2 blocks away. This was an excellent hotel. We booked through AAA & paid $114.00. We would definately use this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Quick Stop on Way to China”
Reviews.Author: duranfreak
Reviews.Content: Loved it! I found it VERY convenient to get from airport to hotel and back from the light link rail. Pioneer stop is right across the street! $2.75/person and about 40 min.
