Nice and easy scenic ride. It was an easy walk from the hotel to the market and the monorail to get to the Space Needle. Hotel itself was quiet, clean, attractive and has a great staff. Our room was really nice. Very interesting hotel decor. Only negative - there was a "gift basket" on a coffee table filled w. snacks and a stuffed animal. Had a young child entered the room, he/she would assume it's free...we didn't have this problem, but I could see it happening to others. We had to leave our luggage with the bell staff coming and going due to our flight schedules--both young men were very helpful. We'd left something in our room at checkout. Hours later, they had it for us when we picked up our luggage. Their lobby has a bar and pool table, and best of all, a place to print boarding passes for free. The on-site restaurant was pretty good for breakfast. The in-room coffee set up is the best I've ever seen in a hotel. Again, great staff. Yes, I would stay here again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “An all time favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: seawall77
Reviews.Content: I *love* this hotel. With week after week of nice, but fairly generic hotel rooms, the Doubletree Arctic Club is a wonderful breath of fresh air. Housed in the old Arctic Club of the early 1900s, this place takes you to a wonderful different time. It's tough to describe, but I feel like I'm walking into an old hotel when it was brand new. The hotel is essentially brand new with a wonderful clubby 1910s city design. Give me an old fashioned and plunk me down in a big comfy couch in the stylish bar or let me unwind in the cozy room. Dark walls and beams, yet spacious and smartly lit. Hardly any shortcuts were taken in the design to make you feel like you're not in 2011...and that's a good thing. On my second stay, they upgraded me to a corner suite on the top floor w/ a balcony. Very nice. Staff was good to great, but not consistently wonderful. I forgave them this because of the wonderful design. The gym is wholly inadequate for a hotel of this caliber, and they should be ashamed of the tiny basement gym. Did breakfast at Juno, the restaurant, and it was decent. A little slow at times though. Nonetheless, I'd love to start out some northwest outdoors adventure with a luxurious couple of nights in Seattle at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel in the heart of Seattle”
Reviews.Author: CityEscapesPhoto
Reviews.Content: Full of elegant charm and friendly, helpful staff, the DoubleTree Arctic Club Hotel is a welcoming place for the traveler to Seattle. Located close to the city’s center, the Arctic Club is within easy walking distance to many restaurants, museums, and Seattle’s famous Pike Place Market. The elegantly understated interior is designed to evoke the ambiance of early 20th century exploration and is replete with portraits of Arctic explorers, maps of the Northwest Passage, and stately chairs and tables reminiscent of the era. Just past the lobby is the Polar Bar, which perfectly exemplifies the hotel’s desire to provide luxury without taking itself too seriously. The Polar Bar, full of deep, comfortable chairs, cloth napkins and polished silver, has a drunken polar bear as its emblem. Our room, though small, was very well appointed. Many amenities were incorporated into the room, including some that we had never before seen in a hotel room. As well as such common things as a coffee maker, hair dryer and ice bucket, we found tea, a loose tea strainer, and a French press. In addition to the large flat screen television, there was a DVD player and a stereo system complete with CD player. The writing desk was stocked with such office basics as a stapler, scotch tape, scissors, rubber bands and a calculator – no need to go to the office center. Robes and a safe awaited us in the closet, as well as a large umbrella (this is Seattle, after all). The mini-bar was fully stocked with an array of beverages from champagne to sodas to fruit juices, and there was a basket of snacks that included an impressive array of choices. To their credit, the hotel made it clear that these items were not included in the cost of the room, but did so in an unobtrusive manner (again, their elegant understatement came through). Upon check-in, we were told that we could empty out the mini-bar to make room for anything that we might want to keep refrigerated, a welcome change from the old-style mini-bars that automatically charge you if anything inside is moved. The bathroom was surprisingly roomy, and was designed for comfort and class. The towels were plush and thick, the bathtub jetted. A marble countertop graced the vanity, which had ample storage underneath. The bathroom door was charming, and included a frosted pane in the upper half. This proved to be one of the very few drawbacks, as it allowed light to spill into the main room (only an issue when one of us was in bed before the other). The staff was extremely courteous and knowledgeable about the area. We were given many wonderful recommendations regarding everything from where to dine to modes of transportation to things to see and do. When they discovered that I was on a hunt for one particular item, the front desk staff took it upon themselves to call three different stores that they thought might carry it, and they checked with me upon my return to the hotel that evening to ensure that my quest had been successful. The housekeeping staff, too, was wonderfully warm, courteous and thorough; our room was kept in tip-top shape throughout our stay. Many small details were attended to that really distinguish this hotel as a top-notch place to stay: a hand-written note welcoming us to our room, a variety of teas (not just black, but green and herbal as well), warm cookies upon our arrival. Overall, we were quite impressed with this hotel, and we would definitely stay here again. City Escapes Nature Photography

Reviews.Title: “Goo Goo G'joob”
Reviews.Author: porkroll
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights in June. Lobby is gorgeous and the Polar Bar is a nice spot to have a cocktail (they have absinthe service). Rooms are on the smallish side but nicely furnished. Wife thought bathrooms were cute as heck. Had a room facing the rear and the HVAC system, which had a low murmur that was not disturbing but not pleasing to look at. Would request a street facing room, which may come with its own bus murmur. Loved the building, former Arctic Explorers Club with walrus tusk medallions adorning the exterior. Easy walking to Pioneer Square, which is a lively area with great histroic buildings and far from the skeezy district guidebooks make it out to be, to Pike Place Market, a tourist haven that lacks local flavor (except for the flying fish I suppose), and to Chinatown if your ideal breakfast is dim sum (Jade Garden) or pho (Pho Bac). Overall, a very good affordable stay (pre-booked the non-refundable rate online), though complimentary coffee in the morning would have been nice (restuarant downstairs does open at 6am as do a couple of nearby coffee places and a piroshky joint).

Reviews.Title: “Steeped in history but with all the modern conveniences”
Reviews.Author: sarahej
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by this chain hotel (Doubletree aka Hilton) that has lovingly restored the former Arctic Club of Seattle. It's a nice mix of modernity with historical touches including photos of the former club members in the foyer. The rooms are smallish but maybe seemed smaller because they have included too much furniture (desk, chair, ottoman, etc.). It's nice to be away from the epicenter of tourism at Pike Place Market and still be close enough with access to free transit right across the street. Front desk staff were helpful and the valets are very attentive. this hotel delivered on all points.

Reviews.Title: “Like at home”
Reviews.Author: vanagas
Reviews.Content: Wonderful service! Special THANKS for Bartender Victor! What a personality and warm friendly welcome... After long business day it was something to look forward to :)

Reviews.Title: “Unique, Vintage Experience”
Reviews.Author: ThreeBells
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on 3rd and Cherry. It is in close proximity to walk to Pioneer Square, the waterfront for dining, Safeco Field and Qwest. The valet service was efficient and friendly. The rooms were extraordinary! The edifice was constructed in 1917 as a private gentleman's club and has an exquisite, original ballroom. The rooms were large and comfortable, much larger than most 4 star hotels. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “CRUISE SHIP PIT STOP”
Reviews.Author: Suzyd1964
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree Artic Club for one night prior to boarding an NCL cruise to Alaska. The location was great - we actually took the Light Rail from the Airport and it was very convenient. Walking Distance to Pike's Market, Downtown, etc. Staff was very friendly. Room was a little small - our bed took up almost the entire room. However, bathroom was great. Did miss having a bath tub but was not a big deal for one night. Only real downside was breakfast in the restaurant on Sunday morning. The room was definitely under staffed and it took forever to be served. Pricey for breakfast, although food was decent.

Reviews.Title: “Anna Kim and her staff are outstanding”
Reviews.Author: neilvictor
Reviews.Content: This classic hotel, under the under the Doubletree flag is spotless with exceptional service. Although the rooms are small, not uncommon for a property built in the early 1900's, it has the amenities you come to expect from a hotel operated by Hilton. We had a great time in Seattle and this will be our hotel of choice when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Turn of the Century Charm”
Reviews.Author: Nonna-Papa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Arctic Club Hotel for three nights after a cruise. Immediately upon entering the hotel, we felt as though we could have been entering a gentleman's city club. The architecture, both inside and out, was a joy to view in contrast to today's bland buildings. Just past the reception and front desk area, where mens' starched collars and top hats were displayed in glass cases, was a large lobby containing numerous club chairs, ottomans, and sofas flanking an large wood paneled fireplace. A long, illuminated bar with fixed stools reminiscent of an elegant bygone era, was a centerpiece in the room. Our quiet, corner room didn't offer much of a view, other than the Columbia Tower building and the top of the hotel's glass ballroom dome, however the very comfortable couch and bed more than made up for the lack of scenery. The bathroom was very large for hotel standards, and after 26 days of cruise ship showers, I luxuriated in a tub once again. We found the hotel staff to be friendly and accommodating. The concierge took his time to make sure our interests in the city were pointed out and marked on a map he provided to us. As always, with Hilton hotels, internet is an additional cost, which I find very disappointing. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to enjoy a taste of old time charm.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel...staff is AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: TheFiveOs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree Artic Club when we were in Seattle for a wedding. We had reservations for five nights, but ended up staying only four due to missing a connecting flight. The staff there couldn't have been more wonderful, especially considering that we called late on what was supposed to be our night of arrival to tell them that we weren't going to make it. When we finally arrived the next day, they had a room ready for us around noon, which was three or four hours earlier than check in time, too. The front desk staff were just wonderful, and so friendly! They always had a smile, great attitude, and helpful advice. They were wonderful when we needed a cab due to a downpour, and even took our photo when we were waiting for the cab, in our wedding attire! The front desk always had apples (and cookies!) at the ready, too. The lobby and the rooms at the hotel were lovely. It was built in the early 1900's, and recently went through a historic renovation. The feel is kind of like a men's club, leather, rich fabric, and soft, comfy furniture. The bar is really nice, and serves food as well. There are comfy chairs and couches in the lobby, along with a fireplace. There was also a couple of computers with internet access, which was nice, as I didn't really want to pay for the wifi, since I was on vacation and tried not to go online!! Our room had a lovely, large bathroom with a beautiful marble topped vanity and a tub that was deep enough for a nice bath. The bed was super comfy, with nice, soft sheets and down bedding. We had no isses regulating the temperature, either. One day, we got back to our room in the early evening and realized that we'd accidentally left the "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door handle. When I called the front desk to ask for some fresh towels, they insisted it was no problem to send someone to come up and clean the room, which they did quickly and efficiently. One other great perk is the location. The light rail is literally right across the street, so it only cost a few dollars to go to the airport! We planned to do a lot of walking, and didn't want to rent a car. The hotel was 3 blocks from the water, and probably a ten minute walk from Pike's Place. Pioneer Square is about a five minute walk. The Space Needle, and the nicer shopping area (Nordstroms, Macy's, etc.) is probably a 15-20 minute walk from the hotel. For us, it was a great location! I would say that our stay ranks with stays we've had at Ritz Carlton's and other luxury hotels, with the cost considerably less, which is great! We were thrilled with the service, location, quality and accessibility. I can't recommend it highly enough...great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay & Staff”
Reviews.Author: RockyRacoon058
Reviews.Content: The staff was kind enough to find a room in the hotel in order to permit us to check-in early. This is something that is typically like pulling teeth. The staff called our room to make sure that we were comfortable and to see if there was anything we needed. The valet parking suggested that we park overnight on the side of the hotel for free, (no fee on Sunday), since my husband was not too keen on paying the $32.00 to park in the hotel parking garage. I am very picky and observant and found the room to be one of the cleanest I have ever stayed in. The bed was very comfortable, the room was quiet at night, we slept like babies. Love the decor in the room! For food, try the restaurant to the left of the hotel, if you are outside looking into the hotel. Great FRESH ham and cheese sandwiches. We had these for breakfast. They have others to choose from and I am sure that they are just as good. There is also a Subway just steps from the hotel to the left and of course a Starbucks just about any direction you turn. The closest Starbucks is to the right and up the street about a short block or two, (I think this street name was Cherry).

Reviews.Title: “SOMEWHERE IN TIME”
Reviews.Author: Eddiesmom98
Reviews.Content: The Arctic Club takes you back in time but with top notch 21st Century hospitality and customer service. As others have posted the building dates back to 1917 where it was once a Gentleman's Club. The decor throughout is of the 1930's/40's with the original crown moldings. The rooms have a masculine feel to them and are impeccably stylish. The connecting restaurant is Juno's where they serve breakfast, lunch and dinner, they also have a very nice well stocked bar however the Lobby Bar is the gem of the place. Viktor the bartender was great and full of information regarding the hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel and am looking forward to returning again. I was on the 8th floor and heard no street traffic at all, the beds were spotless and so was the room and bathroom. Upon reading some of the other reviews regarding the Arctic Club it seemed they were speaking of another hotel. I found no negativity whatsoever in this hotel nor the restaurant. Most complaining on here possibly didn't express their concerns for a quiet room, more lighting, larger room, etc. prior to checking in but I'm sure if they would have made that known their request would have been taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeriMc001
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the fringe of downtown Seattle, but we had a car and sights were easily reached. The staff was very efficient and friendly...great little restaurant and bar attached... our bartender, Melissa, was great as was her boss. Had a wine bar in lobby. Our room was a little noisy and the staff was ready to reassign us to another room. We declined and she then offered us earplugs. Great bathroom...comfortable bed, nice size room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jandlthay
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Arctic Club and had a great time. Ate dinner at Juno and had drinks at the Polar Bar. Atmosphere in both was great. Food at Juno was pretty good but we can be discriminating - really nothing wrong with it. The hotel atmosphere is what really makes it - think old gentlemens club - scotch and cigars. The staff was friendly and eager to provide help and advice on local attractions. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “bus traffic noise”
Reviews.Author: fishman01
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel in a building with lots of history in a great location, Easy access to downtown and a short distance to Safeco field. Unfortunally, planning to have a sleep past 5:30 in the morning? forget it. If your room happens to be facing 3rd street on the lower levels, the noise from the transit busses and their diesel engins will wake to up (3 rd street is a transit corridor for the am & pm rush hours and there is a constant flow of buses). Had problems with the TV with no reception which only worked once in a while. Staff are extremely helpful and always wanting to go that extra mile, great job to all. Parking is on the high side, close to $40 per night after all the taxes are included.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not close to anything...”
Reviews.Author: elimtn
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel and the staff was great, but location is not convenient to anything really. If We go back we will stay closer to the Space Needle, which you MUST eat at the restaurant! No good views from any of the rooms. Also , Juno the restaurant downstairs is excellst.

Reviews.Title: “In general, a pretty nice place”
Reviews.Author: KuduLady
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Arctic Club due to the convenient location and the reviews of the rooms and the Polar Bar. Loved: - Light rail and bus access with a stop right across the street. This made the trip to and from the airport a real bargain. - Easy walking distance to Safeco Field, Ferry Terminal, Pike Place Market and many other Seattle attractions. - General look and feel of the common areas and rooms Didn't Love: - The traffic noise. We reserved well in advance for a three night stay in a corner room and requested a high floor. Called again a couple days in advance to confirm high floor request. Went to check in early and were given 4th floor and told the hotel was sold out. After complaining a nice front desk person did switch us to the 5th floor but we were told that was the best they could do for our stay. - Rather indifferent service and only OK drinks in the Polar Bar. - Charging $9.95 for w-fi even in the common areas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, exceptiopnal service and great location”
Reviews.Author: riverhawk
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself stayed at the arctic club for a week in March; a weekend convention with time added for seeing the sights. From the moment we checked in we knew this was going to be an excellent week! The Hotel is right on the main bus/light link line so getting back and forth to the convention center was a very easy and short bus ride. From SeaTac airport hop on the light link, get off at “Pioneer Square” the hotel is 30 steps from the top of the escalator, very convenient and very cheap! Our room was a bit small compared to some other rooms, but I chose the "shower only" less expensive room. The room was well equipped and my husband and myself did not find it to be too tight, but others may find it small. The bed was comfortable with very fluffy soft pillows, which I like, but there were other pillows in the closet and I am sure housekeeping would be happy to bring up firmer pillows. For morning coffee we headed 1 block up to the Columbia Tower to get Starbucks coffee and enjoy the amazing view from the 40-something floor. For $5 per person you can go up to the 70-something floor and enjoy a far better and cheaper view of the city and bay that you can get at the Space Needle. We spent our non conference days doing all the touristy sites (we bought a Seattle City Pass online before we went...highly recommended!) then headed back for happy hour at the polar Bar. Bar food (fish & chips, burgers, etc) is half off and there is a different drink every night offered at a reduced rate. Happy hour ends at 6 which was fine for us....up to our comfy room to relax. Viktor, the bartender was amazing; a true master of his trade with a wealth of knowledge and passion for not only what he does, but also where he does it. My husband indulged in a few varieties of Absinthe which Viktor makes in the traditional Czech style. Zenee, the other bartender was classy, friendly and a pleasure to be around, she always asked what we had done that day and if we had fun:) The front desk crew was amazing; from bringing us up cookies (complementary) to or room to making my husband a cup of espresso at 4 am while we waited for the cab to pick us up for our sad ride to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like I was at a Ritz or Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: Nads82
Reviews.Content: Wow - what an awesome hotel. From the historic feel of the building, the charming lobby, extremely welcoming and helpful staff, to the amazing quality rooms. I loved everything about this hotel. The in room amenities were amazing and added an extra level of luxury (e.g., robe, toiletries, tv, music system, dvd player, french press)Great location and perhaps one of the most unique Hilton hotels I have ever stayed in. I will always stay here when in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel in beautiful renovated historic building.”
Reviews.Author: oldgreywolfVT
Reviews.Content: I've now stayed here several times on business trips. Doubletree (Hilton) bought and renovated this century-old "explorers' club" in downtown Seattle, and it is truly beautiful. The lobby, lobby bar, restaurant, elevators and rooms all have their original dark wood paneling and "Pacific Northwest" decor and ambience. My rooms have alrways been surprisingly large and very comfortable. The hotel itself is very quiet, though you may get some minor street noise if you have a west-facing room. The food in the hotel restaurant (Juno) is very good, and the restaurant itself has a nice, relaxed atmosphere. The hotel staff has always been very helpful and pleasant. An added bonus - the Pioneer Square light rail station is across the street - $2.50 from hotel to airport (vs $35-40 for a cab).

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere, great location, excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: cgrotts
Reviews.Content: The light rail from the airport drops you across the street from the Doubltree so this was perfect as we didn't rent a car. This location to the terminal was also perfect for getting around Seattle. We stayed a week and were treated very well be the friendly staff. The lounge was large and comfortable with an old time feeling with lots of wood accents and a large fireplace. The corner room with the king bed was large and very light due to the 5 windows. The refrigerator was well stocked but we had to ask to get it re-stocked. The whirlpool tub was large, clean and relaxing. We ate several times at the attached Juno restaurant and found the food very good, although slightly over priced. The location of the hotel is within walking distance of most all the attractions Seattle has to offer. I would definetly stay here again and recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: emma1913
Reviews.Content: The Arctic Club has made me rethink Doubletree's. This is a fantastic, distinctive place. The restoration of this old men's club was excellent. The rooms are very nice, with great beds, and the hotel has a super nice staff. The fantastic service really made our stay special. We went in and out of Seattle several times on this trip, and changed our arrangements to stay at this hotel each time we were in town. We'll make it our base whenever we are in Seattle. Great location, great people.

Reviews.Title: “Favourite historic hotel with all the comfort and sophistication of a modern high end hotel”
Reviews.Author: fargovespa
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice, and it is a lovely hotel, with beautiful interior. The staff are all professional and friendly. It is definitely worth checking this venue out. It makes a person feel back in the time period of a distinct sophistication.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Well Appointed Hotel in a Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: ConnectingRoom19
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights for a long weekend and enjoyed just about every minute of it. Had read some reviews complaining about street noise... never had to deal with that in part because... Lisa at check-in was extremely helpful and really dedicated to quality service. She had already put us in a high floor room facing and set back from 4th Avenue which was about as quiet both internally and externally as any hotel room I've stayed in. The room was well appointed with practical and attractive vintage items rather than beautiful decorative pieces which are difficult or impractical to use. The television had several HD channels and was on a full swivel which made it pleasant to watch both in bed and in the armchair adjacent to the desk. The bathroom was large with a nice shower head and good sink/counter space. My only complaint about my stay would have been that it was a little dark in the shower even with all available bathroom lights turned on! I mentioned this to the front desk upon checking out of the hotel and was told they are looking into upgrading the bathroom lighting throughout the hotel and would send up the engineer to make sure it wasn't a structural problem specific to the room I had stayed in. Seattle's a great city and this is a wonderful hotel to stay in while you're there whether for business or pleasure. If you're inclined to have a cocktail you wont find a better bartender (Viktor) or happy hour than in the hotel's lobby (called Polar Bar).

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: dkseaverns
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two years ago for my sisters wedding, they were nice enough to put us on the top floors! It's nice to have a smoking area when the place is non-smoking. Great atmosphere, great bar, and great for being on the free bus line section! I miss being there, and wish to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Gailfromhome
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot, and it’s great to find a hotel as welcoming as this one. The downtown location is perfect, but the best thing was the outstanding staff. Everyone I encountered was welcoming and helpful, with what seemed to be genuine joie de vivre. The energetic young concierge deserves special credit for friendliness and helpfulness. My room was clean, large and filled with every comfort, updated in 21st century style while maintaining the atmosphere of the Edwardian gentleman’s club the hotel once was. I met a friend for dinner in the lobby by a pleasant fire -- the dishes from the downstairs restaurant and the lobby bar were both delicious, and the wait staff, again, outstanding. I will definitely make this my hotel when I come back to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Downtown Hotel with Great History”
Reviews.Author: gtbrian22
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The bed was magnificent! The staff was very pleasant and the front doors were always opened for us by welcoming staff members. We were even given extra cookies upon request. The room was rather large and accommodating. We loved making coffee in our room using a French press. Our rooms were turned down thoroughly every morning. Very clean! Also, the location is within walking distance of Pike Place Market, several top-tier restaurants, coffee shops, and retail shops. Additionally, the Pioneer Square station on LINK light rail is only 50 yards away. This provides easy and inexpensive access from SeaTac airport. My wife and I loved the location and the decorative theme of the 1920s tycoon era. We highly recommend this hotel to any traveler desiring a centrally-located, well-staffed up-scale hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: boo98
Reviews.Content: We stay for 4 nights. It's a great hotel, the rooms were terrific, staff very friendly and helpful and loved the cookies. Would not hesitate to stay again or recommend it to anyone. Very central location close to everything you need or want!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: BuffaloJohn007
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 week on businesses. Nice hotel, parking expensive( your in a big city so it should be expected.) Cool lobby bar. breakfast staff was inconsistent, my meal was covered by hhonors so not sure of price. 15 minute walk to pike market. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with lots of History & Character”
Reviews.Author: topgun151
Reviews.Content: Character counts. Loved staying in this hotel. The history behind it is quite fascinating and you really get the feel you are a part of the old fraternal club while you are staying there. The rooms are comfortable and nicely designed so as to not lose that old fashioned charm. I highly recommend this hotel for all travelers, especially those in town for business.

Reviews.Title: “Nice find”
Reviews.Author: gigiduru
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been beautifully remodeled with friendly staff , Location a little out of the way for downtown shopping Our room was quite lovely, larger than I expected, and very comfortable. Nice bed and very nice bathroom. The hotel has a decent restaurant and a nice lobby bar. The only downside is that there are some homeless and beggars out at night.

Reviews.Title: “convenient to public transit, superior staff, clean/comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: DLflier
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel primarily based on location, since we were planning to see a lot of areas downtown. It has a wonderfully unique old-fashioned explorer-type decor with a huge seating area past the lobby and a cool bar, and you can literally see the Pioneer Square station from the front door down 3rd Ave. We found it very convenient (you can take the Link from SEA airport directly to the Pioneer Square station, about 40 mins., then walk across up the street to the hotel). We also used the Link again to get from the hotel back to the airport. The staff was quick to help us with our bags up and down the stairs outside the lobby, and they were very friendly over the phone before we arrived and also during our stay. We were easily able to walk from here to Pike Street market and the waterfront, and the bus system was very good for getting to spots a little north of downtown since the hotel is inside the "free ride" area (e.g., Seattle Center). You definitely don't need to rent a car to get to/from the hotel with your bags, or around town. There is no Hilton Honors lounge, but the breakfast and service in the restaurant downstairs was very good and the vouchers were enough to get a very filling meal each morning. We had a balcony room with a sofa, nice TV, large bathroom w/ whirlpool, and a nice view from the balcony toward the stadium. I especially liked the pull out tray coffee/tea station that we used to make hot tea and French-pressed coffee each morning. The view out of the large windows is somewhat blocked by the surrounding buildings and the building facade, but from our balcony, you could still sneak a view of the Space Needle and see plenty of sky for the sunset, which we thought was really nice. There were also chairs on the balcony. The hotel wasn't crowded at all (we stayed over a long weekend), our floor was very quiet, and the management was kind enough to send us a bottle of wine when I mentioned that we were celebrating our wedding anniversary! We appreciated the gesture, and we'll be staying here again for sure on our next visit to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Experience, Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Suomessa
Reviews.Content: This is just a beautiful hotel, completely different to the normal Hilton chain experience with its unique architecture and interior design. Having not traveled to the north-west before, I really liked the frontier feel of the furnishings and the sense of history. It turned a hum-drum business trip into a 5 star adventure. Service was generally very good, from check in to the ordering of taxis. The room + breakfast deal was a bit stingy but that is typical of the Hilton chain and there were enough good things to offset that small irritation. The room was not huge but it was well appointed. The bathroom was almost as big as the room itself and had a nice, old fashioned feel to it. In terms of location, it is about 10 minutes to Pike Market and a bunch of other stores like Maceys. It seemed like a good position, not too close to the crowds but close enough to walk without a big hassle. There is a really nice, spacious lobby bar as well, which looked like a great place to meet people before going out. Overall, staying here gave me a great first impression of Seattle and the staff made me feel very much at home. If I could have stayed longer, I would have and while the price was not super cheap, I thought it very fair for the quality of the hotel. I just hope the Hilton chain doesn't try to redesign it or turn it into another bland chain experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful- beware traffic noise”
Reviews.Author: DisneyFan30
Reviews.Content: Located in Pioneer Square, no self-parking. Lobby deco. in 1920's men's clubs/ climbing club. First rm. we were given was small and loud. Street noise is really bad, so ask for highest floor. There are huge floor to ceiling windows, great for people watchings (yes, the crazies-I wouldn't walk around after dark). Room's are very clean & have fun decor. Great plush towels, comfy pillows, sheets & duvets smelled freshly laundered. Very comfy bed- great nights sleep. Beautiful hotel, can't wait to stay again. The hotel room service from the hotel rest. "Juno" was horrible. It was salty, over-cooked, over-seasoned and over-priced. The famous chocolate chip cookie pudding, was raisin bread pudding. Not a single chocolate chip in it. Skip the room service & probably the rest. if it's any indication. It's a shame, such a lovely hotel should have better room service.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room; dim lighting”
Reviews.Author: ats262m
Reviews.Content: Extremely disappointed with the very small room, especially as a loyal (diamond) customer. Hardly room for 2 people to be comfortable. Lighting was very dim, I'm sure on purpose to provide old-style mood but was not practical either for reading, or for use in the bathroom. Everything else about the hotel was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but too much street noise”
Reviews.Author: chirish61
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. it is a restored gentleman's club and they've managed to capture that vintage feel in the hotel and in the rooms as well. Beautiful architectural details throughout the building, the dome room on the 3rd floor was especially impressive. We stayed on the 3rd floor in a corner room. check in was a breeze, we arrived early from Vancouver on Amtrak and our room was ready. The room had 10 foot ceilings, lot of windows, beautiful bathroom, the only complaint I had about the room itself is it's too dim. I know it's in keeping with the atmosphere of the hotel, but I prefer a well lit room. Now to the street noise. Our room faced 3rd Ave on one side where buses ran all hours of the day and night, the bus stop was right under our window. we heard garbage trucks, recycling trucks, which all seemed to collect after 11pm at night. On our last night we were woken up about 4-5 times during the night from street noise. so although the beds and the room were very comfortable, our sleep was always interrupted. If you do stay here, ask for a room away from 3rd ave.

Reviews.Title: “In a word...Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2GoBaltMD
Reviews.Content: We were trying to avoid the typical hotel chains but based on the reviews and description decided to take a chance on the Doubletree Artic Club. We were not disappointed! Despite the "Doubletree" label, it felt more like a trendy, boutique hotel than a major chain. The classic, "social club" style came through in the unique architecture and elegant lobby. The walrus-theme added a fun element and the fireplace made it feel very cozy. The staff was warm and welcoming and checkin was quick & easy. Loved the chocolate chip cookies upon arrival! (We promptly made Starbucks coffee in the room with our french press to enjoy with our cookies. Nice touch!) We opted for a corner room which was totally worth the upgrade. We had windows all around and the room was lovely. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the whirlpool tub was a very nice addition. The only slight issue was the low lighting. Very romantic at night but not ideal for getting ready to go out. The entire staff was so helpful and friendly (especially Stephen who spent additional time with us making suggestions on restaurants and getting us familiarized with the area and public transportation options.) We had dinner our first night at the Polar Bar and it was one of our best meals of the trip! My husband also tried Absinthe for the first time. Interesting. We ordered room service for breakfast the day we left to save time and it was excellent as well. My only regret was not buying the stuffed walrus and more cookies to go. If we are ever back in Seattle, the Artic Club will definitely be our choice!

Reviews.Title: “luxurious rooms - best night's sleep in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: carrotsarered
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Seattle around ten in the morning - just off the Amtrak train from Chicago.The reception staff were efficient and friendly - checked us in straight away with no hassle and a warm cookie. I was feeling really grubby and desperate for a shower before we set off exploring the city. Our room was lovely - and although it was looking over a busy street we heard no noise. I thought the room was very spacious and well decorated like the rest of the hotel. We ate a meal in the restaurant in the evening and the food was good.I would definately recommnend this hotel to others and would stay again if I went back to Seattle. I loved the idea that the hotel had an interesting history.

Reviews.Title: “More like a luxury Boutique hotel than a Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: lfisgd746
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree Arctic Club is not like a standard Doubletree AT ALL, it has a sumptious luxury boutique hotel feel. Not to mention it is on the National Register of Historic Places. As soon as you walk in you feel like you have stepped back in time, rich wood accents, and black and white framed photos greet you. Everything is elegant. Check-in was quick. We were using Hilton reward points for our stay and were upgraded to a top floor suite. The room was amazing! The bathroom was HUGE, complimented with marble countertop and tasteful tile work. The décor had a feel of contemporary and classic at the same time. The outdoor rooftop balcony was a nice extra. The bed was heaven! Our stay here more than pleasantly surprised us, HIGHLY recommend. The hotel is only three blocks from Pioneer Square, close to I-5 and roughly 20 minutes from the airport. For dinner, the Space Needle is touristy but worth the visit. The views are unbeatable especially if you go when you can watch the sunset. The food is very good and the wait staff extra attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome rooms - unfortunately had a fire alarm malfunction”
Reviews.Author: CookieM0nster
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms via Hotwire, and then phoned Doubletree to arrange specific room types. The staff was very pleasant and efficient, and arranged exactly what I needed with adjoining rooms. Check in was easy – although the one way streets of downtown meant we missed the valet parking on our first pass. The lobby/lounge is very stylish and clean, but seemed a bit too dark for me. The rooms are awesome, and quite large and very clean – except we found an empty water bottle from the previous guests under the window. Location is very handy to restaurants, subway, and a short walk to Pikes Market, Pioneer Square. Unfortunately, the fire alarm malfunctioned at 7:30am – which made us start our day a little earlier than we'd planned on. But the front desk was so understanding, she cleared our valet parking charge for the inconvenience. The front desk clerk even asked the bellhop to show us the Dome Room, to help brighten our 'early' morning. It did the trick. One of the most awesome function rooms I've even seen in a hotel. All in all, and great stay. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully updates to a classic property with great service and super comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: nutmeg8629
Reviews.Content: I really can't say enough about the beds. That may have been the most comfortable bed I've slept in. The hotel itself is gorgeous and sends you back to early 20th century. The renovations were done spectaculary, loosing none of it's charm. The staff were all expetionally friendly and helpful. I was a bit concerned by the most recent review before mine indicating a problem with bed bugs and so I thoroughly inspected our room before settling in and the only thing I found was an incredibly clean room. Honestly I tore up the bed, checking everywhere for the tell tale signs and found nothing. We slept wonderfully and had no bites anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vibe,Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: dgalles
Reviews.Content: I couldn't say enough cool things about this place until I came home with bites all over my face.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but terrible customer service. Wouldn't stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: stp234
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff at the hotel were extremely unfriendly and unwelcoming. The hotel is in a great location, nice, clean rooms, but for the price I expected decent customer service. It was obvious that the staff didn't want to deal with customers - from check in, to later when we asked for directions to a nearby restaurant. No breakfast, no cookies, nothing offered for free. They definitely did not live up to Hilton standards. We stayed at a Hampton in Oregon, on our way to Seattle, and the experience was the opposite - extremely friendly, welcoming staff.....WITH breakfast, for a much lower price.

Reviews.Title: “Gentleman's club style with great rooms”
Reviews.Author: daveandann1010
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel - great staff, lovely room (well - we got upgraded to a suite, though the room we had before the upgrade was pretty darn good!) - really great location - easy walk to centre of Seattle / ferry / pioneer square; super easy free bus service using the Seattle bus tunnels to wherever you wanted. $2.70 to/from the airport on the new light rail service - drops you off at Pioneer station (3rd and James is the exit you want) - maybe a whole 30 feet from the door of the hotel. Video on demand for a couple of nights in watching a movie. We stayed 13 nights... Restaurant on the ground floor a bit pricey for what it was, but there's plenty of better places to eat in Seattle. Would we stay again? Heck yes!

Reviews.Title: “Never again will I stay at a Doubletree Hotel”
Reviews.Author: theHawaiians
Reviews.Content: We have always stayed at a Doubletree hotel no matter where the location. It is always where I search for when we start researching destination. After this experience NEVER AGAIN. Upon check in we were informed that our reservation was cancelled due to not showing up on time. I had called a day in advance to inform them that we would be arriving the next morning but had booked an extra day so that our room would be ready upon arrival. We were placed in a temporary room until our room was ready. For inconveniencing us they gave a certificate for a dinner for 2 at Juno. The restaurant below. It was AWFUL. Food was bad and found a hair in the bread. Not just dropped in but actually baked in the bread. Ok so we had perfect weather and "Seattle was great. We thought everything was good..until I got home. I prepaid for a discounted room rate prior to leaving for Seatlle. Well I guess with the mess up in cancelling our reservation they also charged us again for our stay. I called to have Hilton reverse the charges and they had informed me that they already did and that the location was responsible for the error. The hotel had charged the card that I had used to book the reservation and credited the card that I had used upon check in for incidentals. Upon receipt of my credit card bill I see that they had a field day with my credit card. Charging over $2500 ...I called them once again. They stated even though they had erroneously charged my credit card numerous amounts of time they ultimately gave me the correct credit. So tough luck for me.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Classic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Muskydoc
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Arctic Club over the Labor Day weekend. It has the charm of an older hotel, but up to date in all the room and bath facilities. We had a room on the six floor which was comfortable and quiet. The bed was great. A/C kicked in and out a lot, but once I figured out how to have the fan stay on low it was better. The front desk staff were great with directions and any help needed and always offered up more of those tasty cookies! Housekeepers were great. Forgot our coffee a couple times, but were there immediately when called. Hotel is great for catching any of the mass transit vehicles and also a nice walk to the Market. Check out the ballroom even if you don't have an event there. We have no regrets and would stay again when we are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KLBWylie_TX
Reviews.Content: I have never been to Seattle, but my husband and I were cruising to Alaska and chose the Arctic Club because it is in the Hilton Family (Diamond members), had good reviews and seemed a good location to downtown. We stayed pre (one night) and post (2 nights) cruise. Lobby with bar is lovely and quiet place to relax. The room we were given for the pre-cuise night was on the 6th floor and very, very, very small. You really can't turn around in this room. However, we were okay with it because we were only staying one night. The room is beautiful with all new bedding (wonderfully comfortable), two tall windows (no view), dark chocolate crown moldings and a dresser with built-in refrigerator and coffee/tea bar. The desk is fitted with business traveler needs (pens, paper, highlighter, stapler). The bathroom is quite nice with hairdryer, make up mirror and small bottles of shampoo, conditioner, mouthwash and body lotion. We had breakfast in Juno which was very good, but expensive ($43 for two). The waitress seemed like she just woke up and never really seemed like she wanted to be there. We took a three hour bus tour around Seattle that I highly recommend provided by Tours Northwest. The hotel also has a car service on hand that we used for travel back and forth from the airport and Pier 91. Cale Car Service is very reasonably priced, and offers personal service. After a week cruise, we arrived back at the Arctic Club and this time we had a room on the 9th floor. Atleast twice as large as the first room with a seating lounge area. The room was outfitted the same as smaller room. I would not want to stay at this hotel if the smaller room was the only one available. Front desk and Conceirge (Stephen) were very helpful during our stays. Hotel is within walking distance to downtown and waterfront (Ask front desk for a great map). We enjoyed the walks and felt very safe on any street. Several coffee shops, restaurants and sandwich shops on every corner. I couldn't resist a bundle of flowers for only $10 at Pike's Market even though I could only enjoy them for three days. The hotel kindly provided a vase which I left for the hotel staff to enjoy upon our departure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice one off hotel - location good for airport and town”
Reviews.Author: soundofmusicfan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great choice for us. It is literally 2 minutes from the station for the train to the airport, which was very handy. It is not far out of town but I did not enjoy the number of homeless people heading away from town - so make sure you head towards the city centre and not towards the international district if you are walking around. Its very handy for Pioneer Square and the Underground tour though. The rooms are nice and big and you get a chocolate chip cookie when you arrive - which i appreciated as it was 8 am and my room was ready - hurray! The bathrooms are not very big but they are very nicely decorated. Most channels on the tv don't seem to work but there is a dvd player and a cd player with ipod dock.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: RHinBucksCounty
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so bad we never checked in! We were shown 3 different rooms and all were small and had an odor! The bellman however was absolutely the greatest and tried his best to please us without success. He called us a cab and we went to the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Historic Hotel, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: JulieLoves2Travel
Reviews.Content: While I read a few poor comments on Trip Advisor about this facility, I was leary, but it was close to the train station and we had an early train to catch to Vancouver for our cruise, so we went ahead. We arrived early morning; having come from the east coast and while the room was not ready they welcomed us, processed the paperwork, took all our luggage, including laptop, provided directions and how to get around and said they would call once the room was ready. Everything worked as planned, we had a great mini adventure in Seattle, went to the space needle and then they called and said the room was ready. Great room, amazing historic hotel, fantastic staff, great bed. Very pleased, would definitely stay here again even though it is somewhat of a distance from the hustle and buslte of the downtown Seattle happenings.

Reviews.Title: “Coolest hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: aurorio
Reviews.Content: I saw this hotel on a previous trip to Seattle and I knew immediately I wanted to stay there. The old walrus carvings on the building are the first thing that catch your attention. The lobby is gorgeous, full of old photos of members of the original Arctic Club. Staff is mega-friendly and check-in was super easy (the warm cookies are a nice bonus). My room was huge, beautiful, and comfortable. The furnishings are new and elegant, but designed to fit in nicely with the early 20th century vibe. The art on the walls were beautiful sepia prints of Pacific Northwest native people. All together, a very cool, old school vibe. Even the bathroom has some nice, old fashioned touches, coupled with pristine modern fixtures. It was one of the cleanest hotels I've ever been in. Also, the hotel provided a car for my ride to the train station the next day, free of charge. A nice, unexpected bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Waaaay Overrated”
Reviews.Author: rj123456
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel over the Hilton on 6th Avenue based primarily on the ratings on this site. I don't know what I missed at the Hilton but this hotel is either riding on its past laurels or other reviewers have been smoking something. First off, the service was INDIFFERENT. We called in the morning of our arrival requesting an early check-in and the answer was "well, you know we don't guarantee this sort of thing, just show up and see". We got there around 1pm and there was no one at the door except for wedding photographer taking shots of the groom on the elegant but steep 19th century marble steps at the Cherry Street entrance. No one to help with the luggage nor any signs to suggest the friendlier alternative ground level entrance around the corner on 3rd Avenue. At check-in we did get the customary Doubletree cookies were promptly asked to wait pending a phone call. We chose to camp out in the totally deserted lobby. At least it was dark and cool (on a rare warm sunny Seattle day). At about 3:10 (so much for early check-in, even the "official" check in time was 3:00pm) having received no phone call, I stepped up to the desk and was checked in without fuss. Ok, not a big deal but certainly not the service level I expected after the ratings on this site. The hotel room itself was ridiculously small, I'm guess it is no more than 10'x10'. One half of the dresser stayed locked (I suspected it was a minibar and I didn't want to bother running a perpetual argument with our 9 year old, so I didn't bother to ask). The other half had drawers which could not be opened if you had the drop top down for the coffee center on top. I don't think I've stayed in a smaller room in Manhattan. Our room in particular had two large double-hung windows, except unfortunately, the room was located facing a notch in the building footprint so the view was that of a blank wall. The bed linens were outstanding, especially the down pillows. The modern double-paned windows, excellent climate control, and an interior location on a high floor on a weekend downtown meant that sleep quality was outstanding. The bathroom on the other hand was very spacious, tastefully decorated, and was better situated so we had (partial) views of the Seattle public library which is two blocks north. The mosaic tile floor and the marble vanity were nice touches. I understand the need to conserve water and most hotels in this class have adjustable heads that trade off water flow and pressure. However, this shower was one of those "rain bath" affairs - about a 8" wide head with acceptable water volume but not enough pressure and no adjustments. In terms of location it IS very convenient to the transit tunnel but compared to other downtown Seattle hotels, that is about the ONLY advantage. This part of downtown has nothing next to it other than the City Hall and the County Courthouse and a huge empty block - presumably something interesting will eventually fill that space. But most of the shopping and touristy attractions are up further north towards the Westlake center area, or south towards Pioneer Square (which is not far). We did not use the fitness center but there is no swimming pool, which is not uncommon for older hotels of this vintage. On Sunday night there was nothing open close by for dinner so we had to take the bus uptown (which is NOT free after 7pm). On Monday we found a decent Thai place on Second Avenue - great prices after all $25-$30 per person places over the weekend. I would also recommend the Vietnamese sandwich shop whose name escapes me now but is near 2nd and James, NOT the one on Cherry & 3rd which is twice as expensive. Pick up a couple of banh mi (Vietnamese sandwiches) - we had the grilled pork and the chicken and they were both very good and a steal at $2.75. They did give us a late check out (till 2pm) without fuss and stored our bags till we took the train to the airport in the evening. All in all an unobtrusive hotel, nothing really wrong about it but I am giving it fewer points to balance what I perceive is an overrated rating but other reviewers.

Reviews.Title: “no problems would love to go back”
Reviews.Author: hourigan1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in early august. Initial thoughts were that it was unusual but my teenage son thought it was cute. very clean, staff at reception were brilliant and very helpful. When we visit a city , we usually like a clean , handy , fairly well located hotel as we tend to spend very little time in the hotel. So a reasonably priced hotel is what we look for. Doubletree fits our criteria and i have no difficulty in recommending it. If we are ever back in Seattle from Ireland we will staying in the Doubletree. One lovely young tall girl at reception , never got her name, but she was so helpful to us.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: Sal056
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel well in advance based on reviews for 5 nights as we were attending a wedding in Seattle. We found ourselves with an extra night in Seattle and couldnt add a night as they were full so we booked another hotel The Monaco. This proved to be a mistake as after one night there we were so disappointed in the Arctic Club. This hotel is a Hilton Hotel which I have found over the years to be a disappointing chain all round! We arrived to find that outside the front the building across the road had had a fire so there were massive generators going 24 hours a day making an incredible noise - while this was not the fault of the hotel we felt that given the noise we should have been allowed a refund and to move but this wasnt an option. We were given a room out the back to try and get a room that wasnt noisy - the room looked over a back parking lot and the airconditioning unit so it was nearly as noisy as being at the front. As we were there for 5 days this was really disappointing in a pretty city like Seattle. The hotel is situated on the border of new downtown and old downtown which is not bad and there are free buses covering the downtown area. The decor is based on the hotel once being an exclusive club for men in the early 1900's. It is dark and dour and victorian and seems to consist mainly of dull photos of men dressed in suites plastering all the walls. The restuaurant has a limited menu and was expensive. The room was small and dull and as I said had NO aspect. We did get a call about the room asking was it ok but no offer was made to move us somewhere better or upgrade us. Also there was no free wifi in the rooms which we had come to expect as every other hotel we stayed in it was free!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but some problems”
Reviews.Author: Walt55
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights. Nice to have Pioneer Square light rail/bus tunnel across the street. But very small room by Seattle standards, considering the price. Front desk service fine, but the people servicing the room leave something to be desired. This place has French press coffee pots in room, a nice touch, but one day ours was missing altogether. The sink drained very slowly, we left a note and it was better but not great afterwards. Other details were not consistently attended to. And although it didnt affect us, on the 3d avenue side of the hotel there are a couple 24-hour generators or HVAC systems mounted on trucks that run all night --definitely inquire about them! We had no view, but that was better than all-night generators droning out the window! Also stayed at the Renaissance & Westin on same trip, each was better and about the same price. Skip the downstairs restaurant for breakfast and go next door to Piroshki on 3d.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel and Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: piston11
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Arctic Club Hotel a little before check-in time and were greeted with a smile. One of the two rooms was not ready so we left the luggage in the other room and went out to explore the town. The front desk was nice enough to call us when the second room was ready. We loved the little details at the hotel like the walrus room numbers, the absolutely beautiful ballroom, the explorer decorations, the free internet and printing, and the warm cookies. We couldn't resist lounging in the bar area and partaking in the fancy-schmancy drink of the day. Our bartender made a champagne, vodka, chambord concoction that was delicious! A week after our stay, when we came back from our Alaskan cruise, we wanted to walk around Seattle, and the hotel staff were nice enough to let us keep our luggage in the hotel until we had to leave for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Rather disappointing service.”
Reviews.Author: Nannarpite
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend with my husband who is a HiltonHonors Gold member. We could have stayed at the Hilton and received a better rate but, after reading the reviews and looking at the photos, I really wanted to stay here. We got to the hotel earlier than check-in time (our flight arrived at noon, so it couldn't be helped) and were told that no rooms were available because check-out was 1pm (not true). We decided to leave and go for lunch, so the gentleman checking us in took our number and said he'd call when our room was ready (he did not). He did, however, stop to answer the phone while we were in the middle of talking with him. When we returned our room had apparently just become available. As a gold member, upgrades are given based on availability, but when my husband asked about this he was told the hotel was full and there were no upgrade available (we later found out that this was also not true). We were assigned a very nice room, but it was located right by the elevators on the 3rd floor and overlooked a stretch of 3rd Ave which was undergoing some type of construction. We were too tired to go back down to the front desk to ask to switch, and also did not realise till later that we had not been offered any of the gold perks (free breakfast, wifi, or points), and we didn't even get a cookie!!! The horror!! When we later inquired breakfast, Jackie at the front desk was very apologetic and actually mentioned that our reservation indicated that this option had not been offered to us. Overall, the Arctic Club is very nice. The decor is much more inviting than that of a traditional hotel and it is conveniently located beside the Pioneer Square light rail station. This is great for getting to and from the airport. The breakfast at 'Juno' was also very good, as too was the service from everyone else we encountered after we checked-in.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Place”
Reviews.Author: afineguy
Reviews.Content: This is not your normal Doubletree. It is an old club and has some cool quirks. My room was really small, not sure if an upgrade was possible as Gold VIP. The bathroom and closet were very large. It had a great bed and TV and an explorer theme that was fun. Location near Pioneer Square is nice. Staff was friendly and helpfuI and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Once great hotel declines in quality”
Reviews.Author: KenMundt
Reviews.Content: I travel to Seattle on business one week a month. Until May of 2010 the Doubletree Arctic Club Hotel was my favorite place to stay and an excellent value. I like the location, which is in easy walking distance of both the financial and shopping districts. The check in experiance is always good and the front desk always very helpful. However, over the past three months both the restuarant (Juno) and the housekeeping have deteriorated. The restaurant service and food quality, especially room service, is now haphazard at best. Housekeeping has missed my room completely once in July and twice (so far) in August. I have had two occasions when the typical amenities (soap, shampoo etc) have not been in the room when I checked in and two more where they were not restocked after use. This is probably not a problem if you are staying for a couple of days but when you are trying to get ready in the morning and discover you have no soap, washclothes, towels or bathmats it is more than a little troubling. There is also an increasing amount of deferred maintainence at the property, mostly stained carpets, balky card readers in the elevators and things like that. When I have stayed at the hotel before this month I was able to enjoy HBO but that channel is now gone and several others are also gone. All in all this hotel has the appearence of a change in management and some severe cost cutting measures. Where I would have recommended this hotel without hesitation three months ago I now have to say "proceed with caution".

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service--Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: CAR50
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Seattle via Amtrak and went to our hotel around 11 a.m. (About a six block walk from King Street Station). Our room was not ready yet, but they took my phone number and said they would call when our room was ready and would store our bags. Well, at around 12:15, they called and said we could check in. Our check-in procedure was very smooth and pleasant. The chocolate chip cookies hit the spot since we had not had lunch yet. Our bags were then delivered to our room. Since we did not have a car, the hotel was very convenient to Pioneer Square (about 3 blocks), the water front (about 6 blocks) and the transit tunnel (across the street). With the transit tunnel and the monorail, the Seattle Center (Space Needle area) was very convenient also. The room was a little smaller than I thought it would be, but was very quiet and the bed slept great. The overall service from all the employees we encountered was very professional and friendly. Definitely a very pleasant and relaxing stay. By the way, don't miss the view from the Columbia Tower (1 block from the hotel). Twice as high as the Space Needle and much, much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT staff and slept like a baby”
Reviews.Author: VancouverValleyGrl
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, historical hotel close to many attractions. L-shaped room was nice, beds were very comfortable, bathroom was spacious and floor tile was beautiful, hotel staff was exemplary (front desk and valet). Only downfalls: our view was of a construction site across Cherry Street, no swimming pool, shower only (no tub).

Reviews.Title: “Classy, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: pickyguest
Reviews.Content: My husband was here on business, and my son and I tagged along. I picked this hotel after reading several reviews here, and they were quite helpful. This is a lovely old hotel with beautiful historic decor and early 1900's charm. Rich woods, intricate architectural details, a comfy, quiet lobby with a fireplace and pool table (though my son was bummed he couldn't play because it was technically in the bar.) Very comfy beds, room and bathroom. No bath but a generous shower. Nice view of Smith Tower and the port beyond from our 8th story room. Yes it's noisy in the area, it's in the business district and all the buses come by on Third St., but Seattle is an urban city. Things do close up early in this area of town, and it gets quiet early. Lots of restaurants in walking distance and quite possibly, the coolest toy store we've ever found, Magic Mouse, down on First. (Also, a high concentration of homeless, but we felt mostly safe.) It's a healthy walk to Pike Market, but very doable. Ferries are very close by, as is a light rail station entrance. Even the food at the hotel restaurant Juno was good, which is why we were a little baffled at how empty it was. Oh well, a lovely albeit too short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay…but pricey.”
Reviews.Author: gonezen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here earlier in the week for our last night of a week traveling in Washington State. It was a great ending of a great trip for us. We're big Seattle fans anyway and I really prefer hotels with some history so the Arctic Club had a head start before we arrived. When we did arrive everyone was friendly and we got a very warm and personable welcome by the front desk, concierge and car parker. We were shown quickly to our large room which was upgraded for Diamond status. The hotel oozes history of that Northwest and Alaska variety. Yes, it's a bit dark, lobby and room, with varnished wood and sepia photographs of the original Arctic Club members. I call it atmosphere. We loved the walrus icons everywhere and only wish there was a line of logo'd items for purchase in the lobby. That walrus and Arctic logo would look good on a t-shirt or polo. The bathroom is great and has that last century feeling to it except for the jetted tub. Comp breakfast the next morning was great, service speedy and friendly. A stay here is pricey though. Our room with one night and parking came to nearly $300 once the local taxes are added on. That's a bit dear for us so I wouldn't make a long stay here unless I was on the company's dollar. But for a one night stand the Arctic Club was great and recommended if you like a clubby, historic feeling to your hotels. A complaint: why do some hotels persist charging for internet when you can stop into any Starbucks and use it for free?

Reviews.Title: “Grand Elegance”
Reviews.Author: Elfinize
Reviews.Content: The feeling when you step into the lobby of this gorgeous hotel, is one of bygone luxury and elegance. The atmosphere is subdued and dark, but in keeping with the era, and the appointments are rich and lavish. We were warmly greeted. My sole complaint is that the room was a little over the top in price per night even given the amenities. The lobby is graced with a fireplace, reading retreats, a free pool table, a beautiful wood bar and an efficient bartender who creates great concoctions from the past and present. The rooms were elegantly appointed but the baths were dated, and there were no fans to clear steam.

Reviews.Title: “NIce historic hotel --- but extras left and right so be careful....”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkNYTraveler
Reviews.Content: Definitely historic-- if you like historic, you'll like this hotel but if you want modern, sleek, choose another spot. Very clean, huge bathroom. Rooms, halls could use some additional lighting. Also, the hotel charges for the internet, as well as for watching mostly everything on the TV except for some regular TV channels --- around $14- for a movie!!! Staff was quite solicitious--a definite plus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice updated older property”
Reviews.Author: jlabsher
Reviews.Content: Hotel is quite nice but older so the rooms are small, good central location about 5 blocks from Pioneer Square and Pike Place Market, however not too much in the way of restaurants/drinking near hotel. Lobby bar is exceptional for a Doubletree property, however Juno restaurant downstairs isn't the best - took us 45 minutes for breakfast one day and 30 minutes the next for just bagels. Hotel is 1/2 block from light rail station to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Where the "old boys' club" used to meet...”
Reviews.Author: CodgersontheMove
Reviews.Content: A wonderful old hotel, which has undergone an extensive renovation, is located centrally to shops, restaurants, etc. The rooms are a bit on the cozy side, but are, nonetheless, very nice indeed. The bathroom is a work of art, bringing back memories of days gone by. The hotel staff were very accommodating and helpful. Seattle suffered record heat (104 degrees) while we were there, but we enjoyed the stay anyway, in part because of this small botique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place!”
Reviews.Author: Andrew_Jameson
Reviews.Content: A fun hotel; it's been recently renovated, and you can get a sense of the history from the decorations in the common areas. Our room was very nicely laid out, with a large bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: tartertwo
Reviews.Content: We were traveling on an Alaskan cruise and decided to spend a few nights before the cruise, I booked this hotel way in advance in it was a great deal. The hotel staff was very friendly and accomodating, the concierge, was very knowledgable and helpful with everything. This is an older hotel with alot of charm. but clean and upgraded. We truly enjoyed our stay. It was a little bit of a walk to the sites, but not too far (and I am not a walker) there is a pool table down stairs and quiet lounge just beautiful and inviting (with a fire place and everything!) I would highly recomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: UKSnowbird
Reviews.Content: We booked for 2 nights here before a cruise and can say the stay was very pleasant. We had requested a top floor room and this we had - no problems with traffic noise. The view was of the adjacent high buildings - yes you could see the carpark but the awesome buildings made up for that! The bed was huge - linen perfect and pillows made for a truly comfortable nights sleep. The jetted bath was welcome at the end of a long day walking/sightseeing in Seattle. The room was quite dark but this is the character of the room and it really seemed comfortable and cosy albeit not small. We would certainly recommend the hotel for a pre-cruise stay. We were grateful for the services of Aaron (concierge) who arranged a taxi to Pier 91 for only 25 dollars! Aaron was also very helpful in advising us how to get around. We used the underground bus a lot just to get from one end of the town back to the hotel after a long day but it is also easy to walk. A real gem in Seattle - don't forget to look up to see the walruses (?) on the outside of the building. We had breakfast one day in the restaurant but the bakery two doors along is good also!

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel in the Emerald City”
Reviews.Author: sidel
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest hotels you'll find, not just in Seattle but in the whole of the USA. Decor and ambiance are perfect and the staff were very helpful and pleasant. The old lobby is absolutely beautiful and is an excellent hint as to how your room will look. Free internet in the lobby was good considering that it costs about $10 per to use the wifi in the room. Free newspapers and cookies at the lobby also. Rooms are amply sized and really clean, especially the bathroom. Our room was on the first floor and the window over looked (more like under looked considering the size of it) Columbia Tower. This room was a bit noisy at night, but this was from the street outside (mainly traffic noise) but it's to be expected staying downtown in a city. Stick some ear plugs in and you'll nod straight off. Oh yeah, and the beds are HUGE! If we're ever back in Seattle - we'll be staying here again - no question about it!

Reviews.Title: “Great historic hotel. Completely...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great historic hotel. Completely restored. We had a hard time knowing where to park since we weren't from here. The bellman saw us circling and got our attention and told us about the free parking as an option to the valet parking the hotel offered. We had two queen beds and the rooms were quite large with a small sitting area and large desk area. There is a French press and coffee and tea. The bathrooms were also quite large with early 1900 feel. Lots of wide crown molding and beams throughout the room. If you want atmosphere, this place has plenty. The beds have nice mattresses, down comforters and pillows. Very plush. There is also a flat screen tv.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: ReluctantRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: A classic hotel that has been lovingly cared for and refurbished. Staff were extremely attentive, friendly and helpful. What a delightful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful gem in the heart of downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: swaynewilson
Reviews.Content: The Arctic Club Hotel is rare find in the numbing sameness of chain hotels. This delightful gem is located in the heart of downtown Seattle and walking distance to many of the night spots, sports stadiums, shopping, etc. I chose a corner, jetted-tub room. Extremely well appointed complete with stereo, flat-panel HD TV, wireless, and most importantly Starbucks in-room coffer w/french press! Staff is friendly, room service was delicious and prompt, and the Juno restaurant is a convenient stop for breakfast on the way out. I will be adding this to my list of favorite hotels. Can be a bit noisy if you are sensitive to street noise so be sure to request a higher floor room. Planning a nice event? Check out the Dome Room as a possible venue, it is really beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful - elegance and comfort!”
Reviews.Author: BrightblueSunflower
Reviews.Content: Wonderful and elegant hotel! Friendly staff - special thanks to concierges Albert and Patrick, who kindly helped us to find sport and live music events during our stay, as well as a very lovely restaurant to enjoy a perfect dinner! Beautiful and stylish lobby bar. Very comfortable bed in room. Valet service worked fast and well. Hotel's only minus was the slow and somewhat unprofessional service during breakfast in Juno restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “One Year Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Pete962008
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Seattle for our one year anniversary. We loved the hotel, the staff was extremely friendly, hotel was very clean, and they upgraded our room when we told them why we were in Seattle (every time we came back in they would give us 2 bags of cookies-we had to sweet talk em though). We took the light rail from the airport, it was very easy to use and the light rail stop is less then a block away from the hotel. We did use the light rail whenever we went to Pike's Place Market, mainly because the hotel was far away. Great hotel, very classy, staff was great, clean room, and even a nice little workout room with the bench-bars-dumbells and everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful big city hotel with turn of the century feel”
Reviews.Author: solomon5
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel from the moment we entered the lobby. The historic details are excellent and well kept. We liked the portraits, top hats, and collars displayed near the check in desk as well as the key cards with character. The mascot Walrus is everywhere. Our corner room on the 8th floor was well equipped with a good coffee press and hot pot as well as several electronic items in addition to the television. The bathroom was large and had a jacuzzi tub. We laughed that it had the word "Bath" stenciled on it. It was pretty obvious what it was. Lighting was not the best. If we had not had a flashlight the safe in the closed would have been totally useless and I felt the reading lights were dim. It was also somewhat noisy especially early on Saturday morning when the jackhammers started. On the whole we were very happy with the facilities. The people were even better. They went out of their way to help us with directions, suggestions, and whatever else we might need. We felt the location was excellent. We took the light rail from the airport for $2.50, got off at the Pioneer Square stop, went up the escalator and walked out right across the street from the hotel. We walked a lot and some of the uphill stretches were evil. The Pioneer Square and International Districts are very convenient and both have a lot of places to eat. Public transportation is free from 6am-7pm in a large central section of the city. There are buses outside the hotel as well as in the transit tunnel where the light rail stops.
