Folks at the desk will give you a print out of your route or connections. We would definitely stay at this hotel again if we return to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Classy-Cool-Histori”
Reviews.Author: jtf98
Reviews.Content: Artsy, Cozy, Romantic, Historic Hotel, wonderfully comfy beds and linens. Cool bar with great martinis--Ask for the "Gonzo", while you are playing pool or surf the net in the lobby level. Nice touches throughout, loved the leather club chairs, fireplace, walrus toy in room and warm cookies at check-in and at other times. Location is better for someone needing access to the business distric then for the shopping area. However very short walk to ferry terminal and bus stop right at 3rd Ave entrance. If you want to be nitpicky, only "downs" dim lightning throughout hotel, no swimming pool or spa and thin windows.Otherwise staff is super nice and helpful. Looking forward to my next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Don't leave me with Geronimo!”
Reviews.Author: aug2386
Reviews.Content: Very cool hotel. Like stepping back in time. Great service and consistent housekeeping service. Good value and experience. Our only misgivings is the distance to Pike Street area and my daughter being freaked out by the portraits of the old guys on walls in the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Love it Great value in the downtown!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: friendly12345
Reviews.Content: My new home when it comes to downtown seattle. very comfortable, very friendly and helpfull staff.

Reviews.Title: “Would come back...”
Reviews.Author: lb5vb
Reviews.Content: When I think DoubleTree I don't automatically think it's going to be all that nice. I booked the room purely based upon the other trip-advisor reviews and the great deal I got for paying in advance. However, I was pleasantly surprised when we arrived and saw the hotel. It was extremely clean, very beautiful with old moldings etc and, given how old the building was, the room was very large and had a great bathroom. The only thing I'd change is the lighting in the bathroom. It was very dark and hard to put on makeup.

Reviews.Title: “Classic and historic, the Arctic Club is something special”
Reviews.Author: Standby4321
Reviews.Content: Restored to its early 20th Century glory with a fabulous renovation in 2008, the Arctic Club Doubletree is unique, elegant and well-located. Immediately across the street is a mass transit tunnel that provides rail access to Seattle-Tacoma International Airport, as well as a free service area for buses in central Seattle. The famous Pike Place Market is within walking distance or you can grab a bus and ride a couple of stops for even easier access. The immediate area provides plenty of choices for dining and a plethora of coffee shops in the most caffeinated city anywhere. Pioneer Square and the waterfront are within easy reach, too. As for the hotel itself, we especially enjoyed the historic charm and comfortable beds. Rooms are nicely finished and furnished with nice touches like in room coffee using a French press coffeemaker. We've seen some renovations in which the only thing left of the building was something on the order of a paved-over shell, but the Arctic Club celebrates its history throughout -- from historic photographs of its former members on the keycards to careful refinishing and preservation of its finest attributes. The result is 21st Century comfort with an ambiance that keeps the property's past vibrant and alive. We loved it and we think you will, too. Give the Juno dining room a try and particularly the happy hour food offerings at half price. It's a funky menu the celebrates the Pacific Northwest, but you're sure to find something you like. The bar off the lobby is open later and it's a classy atmosphere that harkens back to the hotel's roots as a social club for men who made it their money in the days of the Klondike gold rush.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: lillah19
Reviews.Content: I really liked the Doubletree Arctic Club. I always enjoy staying in hotels that have an interesting history. This hotel has information in the lobby that tells all about when it was a private club during the gold rush. Check out the ballroom it has a beautiful stained glass dome. The room I had was a corner room that was extremely comfortable and had a whirlpool tub. The furniture was attractive and I thought the french press coffee pot was a really nice touch. The location is not particulary wonderful and parking is a pain but I am glad I decided to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Really cool renovated historic hotel - perfect for business or leisure”
Reviews.Author: klingja
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 4 nights here for a work/pleasure trip. This place has a really cool history - built in early 1900's as an exclusive men's club (photos of the members adorn the walls) and renovated in 2008 into a AAA 4-diamond hotel. The staff was all very helpful and friendly. It is literally 1/2 block from the light rail station (exit Pioneer Square station on the 3rd Ave/James St) and you can take the rail from the airport to the hotel (about 30 minute ride.) We were welcomed very warmly upon arriving and had a fun, impromptu history lesson on the way to the elevator given by one of the front desk staff. The room (we had a standard king room) was decorated very nicely, yet uniquely. You could tell the decorator really cared about the history of the hotel when he/she appointed the rooms. Our bathroom was HUGE for a Doubletree. And, it had a cool door. Bed was very comfortable, nice flat screen TV, minibar, etc...the room was nicer than any Doubletree or Hilton I've ever stayed in before. Hotel was very convenient to a lot of cool places - Pike Place Market (5 min.) Light Rail (.5 block) good restaurants (all around) coffee shops (all around) bars/late nite options (2 blocks) etc... All in all - it was great and we would highly recommend it! It did help that work was paying for it (rate was $155/nite) but it was reasonable, and definitely worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NWTravelerMissouri
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with lots of character. The rooms are very nice and the staff was great. Hotel is a bit pricey and parking is valet only. Good location in downtown Seattle. I recommend for business trips and couples.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem of Seattle”
Reviews.Author: MAB28
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree Arctic Club is conveniently situated on 3rd Avenue and the corner of Cherry St in downtown Seattle. It is very easy to find if you have taken a bus to Pioneer Sq, it's one block away and less than a minute to get to the hotel. If you are travelling from the airport, the 194 bus will take you downtown directly and the fare is $2, you must also have the exact amount. When I arrived at the hotel before 2pm, my room was not ready, this was not a problem for me, as a first time visitor, it gave me the opportunity to drop my bags off and explore the downtown area quite easily. The check-in staff were very pleasant and offered me a nice warm cookie before I set off on my way and offered to call me to notify me that my room was ready and I was able to check in. The concierge team were also very helpful in ensuring that I had a good time in Seattle by offering me a map and suggestions for things to do in the city in such a short space of time. I had to leave the city early in the morning and the hotel promptly gave me a wake-up call and offered me a car to drive me to the airport at 5am, this was at a cost of $40. The room I was allocated was of an adequate size bearing in mind that I was a solo traveller, if travelling with another person, I would imagine that the room would feel smaller than most hotels. The bathroom had an old world charm about it with wallpaper on the walls and a classic cosy feel. I was on a higher floor, however, it was still possible to hear the street noise which was a little off putting at times but it didn't spoil my stay. I did not use the lobby lounge but it had a warm 'gentleman's club' type feel with classic furniture, soft lighting, which for me, made the hotel feel intimate unlike other hotels I have stayed in. If you feel like a good walk (10-15 minutes) then head to the Farmers Market then take the monorail nearby to the Space Needle, which boasts some spectacular views of the city. If you don't have an umbrella, the hotel will happily provide you with one! If you're looking for something a bit different from the usual hotels that one can stay in, then I would recommend the Doubletree Arctic Club.

Reviews.Title: “V-day at the Arctic”
Reviews.Author: patiences4not
Reviews.Content: OMG I LOVE THIS HOTEL! It has an old world charm that is off the map. The main staircase and the entry way. The parking was expensive but the corner room and bathtub made up for it!!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: thirtyishseattle
Reviews.Content: I was with my boyfriend and two other couples and we all just loved this hotel! For starters, it has such great old world charm and everyone was so friendly and nice to us. The rooms were all very clean and the ameneties were fantastic, oh.. and the beds were just heavenly. We had dinner at the Metropolitan Grill and it was only a block or so away and was a very easy walk. The Juno Restaurant below has a great atmosphere and serves excellent Bloody Marys. We will definately be staying at this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel, Historic Building, don’t bother bringing your car.”
Reviews.Author: JETNJ
Reviews.Content: I have to compliment the builders / craftsman who turned the historic Arctic building into the Arctic Club Hotel, their workmanship is of the highest quality and the decor is outstanding, (my wife and I like it so much we’re going to use their green / brown accent color scheme in our bedroom). We chose the Arctic Club for its location, a few blocks from the train station and being on the LINK light rail line to the SeaTac airport (station stop is Pioneer Square). We stayed for 3 days in a King bed - nonsmoking, and it was the most pleasant hotel experience we’ve ever had. All the staff were nice, polite, helpful, and genuinely seemed to like working there. The room was cosy, immaculate and well equipped (my wife especially enjoyed the french press coffeemaker for her morning coffee, I was impressed by the LG flat panel TV), and comfortable. WiFi internet access is available in the room for $X a day, but there are two computers and a printer available in the business center for free (a godsend for printing boarding passes) so bringing your laptop with you is not as necessary. We then took the ferry to Victoria, BC for a 3 day visit, and returned to the Arctic Club for one more night, this time in a Queen nonsmoking, shower only. While the room itself was a just as nice as the King, it felt crowded because all the furniture and amenities from the King were in a smaller space. It’s fine for one person or two people overnight, but there’s not a lot of spare space. Seattle’s public transit system makes it easy to get around using electric bus, diesel bus, and light rail lines. It’s great for tourists because the Arctic Club is within the free transit zone, which covers most of downtown. No rental cars or taxis necessary For breakfast, go next door to Piroshki’s bakery for Russian/Polish breakfast and dessert pastries and great coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel but get a high floor if light sleeper.”
Reviews.Author: LiangShanBo
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in Seattle. Very convenient to the undergound bus (right on the corner), which is free during day time within the downtown area. You can also walk to Pike Place etc., which 2 bus stops away, in about 15-20 minutes. Hotel was nicely appointed with photos of various Native Alaskans and Western explorers in the hallways and rooms. Restaurant was good. Lower rooms face a lot of street noise from buses, but that is with any city hotel. They do have ear plugs if you're stuck on a lower floor though (I always bring my own for same reason if get stuck next to a noisy family). Only thing I was disappointed with was didn't get a free cookie when I checked in. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Thank you - Christmas was perfect here”
Reviews.Author: Rob S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over Christmas. We had a corner room, which was perfect. We were on the 8th floor so had no problem with traffic noise. Our first stay in Seattle was a fine one, made better by this hotel. Room service was cheap, the bar was great and the staff friendy. The Juno restaurant was good for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “stayed w/ hubby while he was there on business”
Reviews.Author: grapebgirl
Reviews.Content: my husband had to stay in seattle for 2 weeks & i came to visit for a long weekend. this hotel is historic & beautiful. we stayed on the 9th floor in room 901. our room was clean & very comfortable. there was construction going on 4th ave that was noisy, but not to blame the hotel. my husband raved about the coffee & breakfast in the hotel restaurant, juno. i enjoyed that the hotel was walking distance to a lot of shopping & attractions! parking was steep, $36/night, but i think it was comparable to the area. the concierge & desk staff were always helpful & attentive. the fitness center was clean & nice to have on site. although if you go sight seeing you get plenty of exercise just walking around!

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: philandalex
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 2 wonderful nights at this delightful, boutique hotel. From the moment we arrived we recieved nothing other than great service from friendly professional staff. We had booked ajoining rooms and both were roomy, well appointed and scrupulousy clean! The walk to the city centre was an easy one. There is a Right Aid almost next door, coffee shops near by and it is a short stroll down to the 'old' Seattle. Only problem.... did not have long enough!

Reviews.Title: “Fine Stay”
Reviews.Author: chilly_h2o
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a baseball series last July. We have stayed at multiple hotels throughout Seattle over the past few years and this one was the best thus far. highs- Upon arrival we received upgraded room on top floor with nice (shared) balcony and view of stadiums (as a HH Diamond). This is always a sign that the hotel at least has some basics down. The hotel is in pretty convenient location for downtown, walking distance (10 mins) to NFL & MLB stadiums. The rooms were nicely furnished, flat panel TV’s, the bathroom was large & nice, comfortable (high)beds, pillows, linens. The service was generally very good. lows- Parking, when is parking not an issue? It is either too expensive, $35 /day I think, or the street parking is a bit of a pain, with hills and numerous street regulations. We stayed over a weekend, so we parked on the street one block away and it was not a problem, but the hills are kind of a pain to park on unless you are coming from San Francisco or something. The in-house restaurant average, not much in immediate area either—at least that we found. Overall we had a very nice stay. No bargains here, but hey, it’s Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Very original hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: brunneng
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Seattle and I loved it. I guess the hotel contributed to that. The location is great: Downtown, across the street from the entrance to the underground bus shuttle and light rail to the Airport, 3 blocks from waterfront/ferries. Restaurants everywhere. The hotel looks unspectacular, there's a cozy lobby and a nice bar on the ground/first floor (and a great breakfast place, try their lox bagel) Staff is friendly and helpful. The surprise are the rooms. They are not large, but very original. The "arctic theme" is everywhere; walrus on the bathrobe and door sign, frosted doors, trunks instead of bedside tables.. it looks great and is full of little surprises (walrus bottle opener?). There's a city view that should be just fine from most rooms. In terms of comfort, the beds were great, the temperature just right, noise level low. I would return any time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: maryholste
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our first anniversary at the Arctic Club this weekend and it was the perfect place to do so. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. When they heard it was our anniversary they brought us a tray of chocolate covered strawberries and even wrote us a very nice card! The rooms are cleverly decorated with a historic Arctic Club theme and contain every amenity you could think of. The pillow-topped bed was amazingly comfortable and all the linens were fantastic. We had breakfast at Juno, the hotel's restaurant and really enjoyed it. The hotel's location is nice because it's located between the shopping area of Westlake Center and the more historic Pioneer Square. There are lots of shops and restaurants nearby, but the hotel feels like a retreat in the center of it all. And because it's a Doubletree, you get a warm cookie upon arrival! How can you pass that up?

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: lkwok2
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I went down for a weekend getaway from Vancouver. It was quite the late check-in, but the front desk agent, Albert was superb! He welcomed us and we chatted quite a bit. He made us feel very welcome and even gave us warm chocolate chip cookies at check-in. The valet was prompt to park my car. The hotel itself is classy, clean, and you can tell they take great pride in keeping the maintenance. Our room was spacious, had all the ammenties we needed, the towels were plush, the room had an umbrella, an in room safe, the beds were super comfy, all the latest electronics, mini bar and snake bar, and the housekeepers did a great job. You can tell it was an old gentlemens club before, the quality and just the structure of the hotel itself is impressive. I would stay here again and again, and thanks again to Albert for helping us with our luggage at check-out. We had tons of luggage but he didn't hesitate to put them on a cart, and store the items in my trunk. Thanks for making our stay so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, comfortable, a very pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: LAcurlgurl
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best Hilton brand hotels that I have stayed at. The hotel feels very historic, charming, interesting, beautiful, unique and comfortable...A really special place! The staff is very kind and accomodating (and the warm chocolate chip cookies at check-in alone are worth coming back here!) and the rooms are very nice. They are not very large, but there is a lot of attention to detail- soft and comfortable bed, Neutrogena bath accessories, great snack bar, etc. I stayed on the 5th floor, but was not bothered by the street noise. My only complaint was that the fitness room is really small with only 2 treadmills and 1 elliptical, with very low ceilings. The equipment is nice and new, but the room should be larger, have more cardio equipment and have better circulation. My only other minor complaints is the charge for wireless internet and also the dim lighting in the bathroom. I will definitely be staying here on all of my future trips to Seattle and recommend to anyone looking for a special place with great value.

Reviews.Title: “The Arctic Club: One Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoDJ
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just completed a two-night stay at the Arctic Club, during our first-ever trip to Seattle. I can't say enough great things about this property. Not only does it have history in spades (it began its life as a turn-of-the-twentieth-century gentleman's club), but the super-friendly staff and prime Seattle location near historic Pioneer Square make it a must-consider hotel. The rooms, as noted by other reviewers, are very nicely appointed and pay off the overall historic theme/credibility. We stayed on points, but were upgraded to a corner king with whirlpool. The room overall was very comfortable -- great bed and bathroom, in particular. In addition to the points above, the hotel also has a very nice restaurant, Juno, which we visited both mornings for breakfast. The closest thing to a negative about this property is that it's slightly off the beaten path in terms of other busier/more happening Seattle neighborhoods (around/near Pike Place, for example). But we actually liked that because it contributed to a quiet, relaxing stay. We will definitely be coming back to the Arctic Club on future trips to Seattle (oh yeah -- we totally loved the city, too!).

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: zmurman
Reviews.Content: If you love classic hotels with friendly, fantastic service and you're going to Seattle, stay here. They've created a real hotel gem out of a turn-of-the-century fraternal club. You get the feeling of going back in time to a more gentle era. The Polar Lounge area is warm and a lovely place to enjoy a drink or two. Eggs Benedict at the Juno restaurant is a must. A short two blocks from the best steak restaurant in town - the Metropolitan Grill - sit at the bar and enjoy the great bartenders there. Also recommend the Steelhead Diner in the Pike Place market area about 10 blocks away. We loved our stay here and would for sure stay here again. I'd read on some of the reviews that the rooms were on the small side, but our room was plenty large, clean and well appointed, and the staff was very nice and helpful. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Classic”
Reviews.Author: reb-boulder
Reviews.Content: A classic older hotel now run by Doubletree. Classic and classy. Great place for a special event like a wedding. Close to the sound. Walking distance to downtown area and the market. Easy to get to. Staff very courteous and responsive. Internet a bit expensive as are other add-ons like telephone. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Different strokes for different folks”
Reviews.Author: socalbeachbum97
Reviews.Content: Being Hilton Honors, we chose this hotel due the rave reviews on Trip Advisor and a write up from Conde Nast. As international travelers, we've stayed in many Hilton properties and this ONE was disappointing. It isn't that there was anything terribly wrong with it, there just anything great about it. The rooms were extremely dark and small. My experience the bathroom lighting was horrible and kudos to the other Hilton Honors who had a top floor with a balcony. Otherwise, the 'feeling' is very clostrophobic. The location is undesirable and removed from the heart of the city and attractions. Staff was pleasant, but nothing that stands out. If I were doing it over again; I would not stay here. Two nights was more than enough.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, Friendly, Full of Character”
Reviews.Author: Alextrips
Reviews.Content: I've travelled quite a lot and have to say that this is my all time favourite hotel. The staff are very friendly and helpful, Steve the concierge was great and seemed to know the answer to any question we threw at him! The gym is well equipped, there's free internet access in the lobby, warm cookies on arrival, starbucks coffee in the rooms and lovely complimentary toiletries, the beds were super comfy, the showers great, lots of lovely hot water. The decor of the hotel and rooms were lovely and tied in with the character of the place. All in all, in my opinion, unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Could not have been better!”
Reviews.Author: LongBeachJack
Reviews.Content: We took the bus from SEA-TAC airport to downtown and there was a stop across the street from the hotel. The light rail station is also across the street. The hotel is very close to Pioneer Square and walking distance to Pike's Market. I would suggest becoming a Hilton Honors member. We were upgraded to the top floor which had a balcony and a whirlpool tub. The room was large and had floor to ceiling windows. The front desk was very helpful in providing restaurant recommendations and directions. The hotel has a classic feel with modern amenities. It is well maintained. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “A different class”
Reviews.Author: PeteLanc
Reviews.Content: We normally book the interesting budget hotels, but this had a a very good deal so I took the plunge. From the moment you walk in, it's like being back when travelling was a pursuit of the gentlefolk. The hotel has recently been completely refurbished. The foyer is covered in photos of old explorers, the staff were helpful - but not overwhelming. We had a huge room, with a walk-in wetroom. Also a firmish, comfortable bed. The downsides: Had to pay extra for WiFi (pop down the street to a coffee shop) and no hot drinks in the rooms (same solution). It's a few minutes walk from the bustle of downtown, but thats not bad. Well within the free fare zone and handy for the transportation tunnel & light rail to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Vintage glamour”
Reviews.Author: GVJS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Arctic Club this past weekend for a wedding. This historic Seattle building was constructed in the early 1900's, as a men's social club where men with money with gather to share stories about their time during the Alaska Gold Rush. Fast forward to 2006 the property was purchased and renovated to one of Seattle's most unique hotels. The rooms and beds are very comfy. Since we were there for a wedding we were able to visit different rooms from the standard to the standard with sofa bed to the suites with balconies. Every room is done with class with vintage bathrooms with original Arctic Club color tile. The wedding was held in the stunning Dome Room with original artistic frescos, and of course the stained glass dome. Service and food were top-notch. We were also impressed with the valet and bellhops. They were efficient and quick and we didn't ever feel like we were waiting around. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: soansari
Reviews.Content: We ended our Olympic National Park trip with an overnight stay at the Doubletree Arctic Club Hotel. There were many many reviews for many many hotels in Seattle, but the uniqueness of this one caught my eye. It's in a former men's club. But being newly remodeled, they kept the charm of the oldness and added all the new conveniences. It's perfectly located to walk down to pikes market (if you don't mind a leisurely stroll) and the waterfront. We have 2 young girls (10 and 12), and even though the hotel didn't have a pool, they didn't seem to miss it at all. In fact, they've stayed at many upscale hotels (Ritz, Hyatt's Hilton's, etc), and put the Arctic Club in the top 5 of their hotel picks for its comfortable beds/bed linens and room decor. We would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Location, History, Comfort...Artic Club Doubletree has it all”
Reviews.Author: RevRPB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I together with two other couples...old friends going on an Alaskan cruise together...spent two nights here. The hotel was a treat from beginning to end. The staff was friendly and helpful. They were proud of their beautiful hotel and rightly so. The rooms were very comfortable. The location of the hotel is perfect with public transportation easily available. It is a Doubletree, but still feels like the private club it had been. The staff made our transfer to the Holland America pier so very easy. The six of us have fond memories.

Reviews.Title: “Great place that no one knew about”
Reviews.Author: ahavakamm
Reviews.Content: Wow. This place is a hidden gem! I hate staying at the conference hotels when I go to conferences b/c it seems like they raise their prices knwoing everyone is on a stipend. I was lucky enough to book the Arctic Club for four nights for a conference in March. We had a great stylish room and a huge bathroom with great amenities. Our room looked out onto a construction site but if we looked up from the construction we could see the beautiful buildings surrounding us. This place had a wonderful attention to detail. My favorite thing by far was the room numbers decked out with walruses. It seemed a little off the beaten path, but that made the lush lobby all the better. We snuck around and looked at the domed ceiling ball room that was cozy and grand at the same time. The great thing was that the free downtown Seattle bus stopped right outside and I could get to conference for free!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for sightseeing without a car in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: OandL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are retired and we travel about three months a year. We stayed three nights here after traveling through British Columbia, Alaska, Mt Rainer and North Cascade National Parks. We loved everything about the lovely Doubletree Arctic Club Hotel; friendly and helpful staff giving us sinfully delicious cookies, clean and large room with thick towels, convenient location (20-minute walk to Pike Place Market, 10-minute walk to International District or 1-minute walk to public transportation).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Service Could Be Better”
Reviews.Author: platinum1
Reviews.Content: My husband I arrived at the hotel around 1pm and were told our room was not ready. The front desk told us the room would be ready around 3pm asked for our cell phone number and said they would call us when the room was ready. We left our baggage with the front desk and asked if they could put it in the room when it was ready. They told us it was no problem and they would take care of it. We came back to the hotel around 6pm since we did not receive a phone call and inquired if our room was ready. The room was ready but the bags were not in the room. We checked in and a bellman took us and our bags to the room. The room was very nice but on the small side. After checking out the room we went to the hotel bar for a drink. The hotel bar is very nice and large with many seating areas with couches and chairs and even a large fire place. Both days we were there we had breakfast at the hotel restaurant Juno. Since we are HHonors Diamond members we received free breakfast. The food was tasty but the service was very slow and understaffed. This hotel was the nicest Doubletree we have every stayed at. It had a lot of charm, is in a good location and was very comfortable. Even given the poor service I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: mkide1969
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying at the Doubletree Arctic Club this last week on a get-away trip to Seattle. The hotel has been beautifully restored by Hilton/Doubletree. Entering the lobby is like stepping back in time to when the hotel was the Arctic Men's Club. The lobby is decked out in dark woods, fireplace, comfortable couches, dark leather chairs. The Polar Bar is right off the lobby, a perfect place to relax with a cocktail. Play a game of billiards if you like, too. The staff at the hotel is top-notch. Check-in was smooth. The front desk staff were very friendly and efficient. In fact, all staff members we encountered were friendly, professional, able to provide directions to area attractions and gave some great restaurant recommendations (as in Ivar's on the waterfront, or Wild Ginger for Thai food at 3rd and Union; both outstanding restaurants.) Our room was extremely comfortable. We were on the third floor. Huge room in comparison to most standard hotel rooms. Nice entry foyer, with desk, living room, tall ceilings, three windows (that actually open!) Comfortable chairs. Huge bathroom, with jacuzzi tub. Great view of Mt. Ranier from the bathroom. In-room coffee is Starbucks (of course -- this is Seattle!) made with your very own French press. There was a flat-panel TV too (but we never turned it on -- too much to see and do in Seattle, plus we were there for the Rodrigo y Gabriela concert at the Moore Theater.) The hotel is a very short walk to historic Pioneer Square, a short ten-minute walk to the waterfront or Pike Place Market. The Space Needle was easily reached by using the bus/light rail transit tube then transferring to the monorail. The transit tube station is across the street from the hotel. We did eat breakfast one morning in Juno. Our server did seem a bit frazzled but was friendly. The food was great! Lastly, the staff in the Polar Bar was outstanding; really made us feel welcome and made some excellent restaurant suggestions. Plus, there's a happy hour from 3 pm to 6 pm, with a special drink of the day and discounted prices on other cocktails. Would I stay here again? You bet! The staff is wonderful, the location is great, plus you get to stay in a beautifully restored building with a historic past!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great character”
Reviews.Author: olig
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel which was quite individual when you consider it is part of the huge Doubletree Hilton organisation. They have managed to not completely loose the identity of the hotel and blend it into a brand quite successfully. A very memorable hotel. I had a lovely breakfast in the restaurant downstairs. The service was fantastic, friendly but also professional. Mind you, all the staff that I encountered there from reception to concierege were. I experienced no problems with valet parking, assistance with luggage or getting advice and tips for the local area. Room was atmospheric, lovely, large and comfortable room. From the room during working hours you could look directly into the adjacent offices and see staff working which was a bit disconcerting. However, there are layers of different curtains for privacy. Also there are two entrances, one of which is unmanned and requires that you get an elevator/lift to reception. The location and area is great for exploring Seattle which is a wonderful place. However, I did see quite a few homeless people not to far away from the Artic Hotel. Mind you there were quite a few around the market and in several areas of the city. I would certainly go back. The hotel offers great value & experience when compared to other Seattle hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: lafou
Reviews.Content: The transit tunnel and bus stop are right outside. You can stumble out of the front door and buzz around the major areas in no time. You would expect a stuffy atmosphere, but the "vibe" is relaxed. The minor complaints I had were addressed immediately and amicably. The arrival cookie was fabulous. The area around the hotel is a little strange (i.e. Bail Bonds storefront).

Reviews.Title: “Great Find, !”
Reviews.Author: bhtpa
Reviews.Content: My first impression of this place was "Wow, is this really a Doubletree?!" From the moment you arrive nothing suggests a Hilton chain hotel. This is a converted turn-of-the -century men's club and it still retains the dark masculine feel of one. The lobby and bar are beautifully restored and small details abound throughout the hotel, like brass walrus room numbers, My rooms was a treat in itself--a frosted glass door to the bathroom with the word "Bath" stenciled on it, unique furniture, cool light fixtures all done up in a warm gold and marine blue tones with old Artic explorer nuances. A very refreshing change from what is considered trendy these days. Again i could hardly believe i was staying in a Doubletree--the room was much nicer and larger than some Ritz-Carlton rooms i have stayed in (i was in a Premire King room). I do agree with a previous reviewer that the rooms are on the dark side. For me this just enhanced the mood of the hotel. Also, the front desk staff was very pleasant and efficient and the concierge offered great local, insider suggestions-not the usual tourist fare. A couple of small complaints--there was no bellman at the front door when i arrived, meaning i had to carry my luggage up a flight of stairs and through thte front doors myself. Also, my wake up call never came, which had i not set the alarm clock as a back up might have become a huge complaint. Finally--the location is great--just on the edge of Pioneer Square and in the middle of the business district with City Hall across the street. A huge bonus is the light rail and bus tunnel entrance right across the street--meaning that when the light rail link to the airport is complete in December you can ride it to the front door of the hotel for just $2.50, saving you at least $40 in cab fare. (you can still take it now-with a bus transfer for the final leg). Also 3rd Ave is a major bus route and you can hop on the free downtown area buses right outside as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: bombledmonk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had our honeymoon in Seattle and decided to stay at the Arctic Club for the week because of location and very nice price when packaged with airfare. Service was excellent from start to finish and everyone was friendly and helpful from the doormen to the cleaning staff. The beds were extremely comfy and the sheets were changed every day. On the 5th floor facing south, thenoise from the street was definitley always there, but was never to the point of keeping us awake. The Polar lounge in the lobby was fun to hang out in, and the restaurant downstairs was good, but a bit spendy. Location is prime for those who are going to baseball or football games, or need to get anywhere in the metro as the St James bus station exits right to the front door of the hotel. Overall, I would highly recommend the Arctic Club for a couple or single traveler, it was a great experience, price and I will definitely stay there again in future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Men's Club Now A Posh Doubletree Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RailwayHobo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Arctic Club Hotel in September 2009 when I overnighted in Seattle in order to make the connection between my train from California which arrived in the evening and my flight back east to go home. I had originally chosen the hotel because it was a reasonably priced older hotel that was relatively close (about six or eight blocks) to the Amtrak station. The hotel itself is classic men's club that has been converted into a stylish hotel while maintaining (or, more likely, recreating) the ambience of such a club. A lot of effort went into the decorating and it was worth it. The furniture in my room had a vaguely art deco feel to it. The bed was extra comfortable. The bathroom was spacious and very attractive (they had, once again, gone to considerable effort to make it both very modern but esthetically keyed to the period of the club itself). I didn't try the restaurants or the bar, but the latter looked quite inviting. Some huge party was going on when I checked in but my room itself was quiet. One oddity which I am sure was just a bit of bad luck: when I arrived at my room after checking in, the door was propped open. I used my key to confirm that I wasn't going to the wrong room (I wasn't) and then I checked the room and everything was in order. I then locked and bolted the door. Still, it was a bit unsettling. While common, I note that they charged for Internet access, something I consider gratuitous and annoying (especially since more basic hotels almost always offer it for free these days). Still at $200 a night (plus taxes) for a cancelable reservation, I thought it was quite decent value given the alternatives available.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and warm, like your own personal club.”
Reviews.Author: Watthree
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to stay at the Arctic Club Doubletree before and after an Alaskan cruise. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Seattle. Staff: All of the staff members--front desk, bell staff, restaurant workers—were extremely friendly and service-oriented. They all express great concern about customer satisfaction and take steps to ensure that guests are having a wonderful time. Facilities: The hotel is beautiful. It was re-done in 2008. The Polar Bar in the lobby exudes warmth and comfort. The grand ball room is stunning. The rooms are warmly furnished with comfortable beds, overstuffed chairs, flat screen tvs and wonderful pillows. The style is so warm and inviting that I felt at home right away. I had a corner room on the 8th floor and another corner room on the 5th floor; noise was not a problem. The tilework in the bathroom was so neat, I want to use it in my own home. I can’t say enough about how much I liked the style of this place. Highlights: The décor is stunning. Be sure to check out the relief walruses on the outside of the building. Areas for improvement: The elevators were a little slow, but otherwise, I cannot imagine any improvement. Overall impression: Wonderful staff who know what they are doing in a beautifully restored facility make this place a “must stay” in Seattle. Nearby transportation: Downtown transportation tunnel is across the street. Buses run right down Third Avenue. A short walk to the Monorail, or take the transportation tunnel. 20 minutes to airport, 15 minutes to cruise terminals.

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel, but the noise ruined it...”
Reviews.Author: ikonukon
Reviews.Content: At first glance, the hotel looks like a beauty. It's a refurbished men's club and is on the National Register of Historic Places. The bar off the lobby is fabulous. Then we proceeded to our room on the 9th floor, expecting a respite from the hustle bustle of the busy streets below. Were we ever in for a surprise. The windows kept out virtually no noise at all. I love the movie "Planes, Trains and Automobiles," but not playing nonstop in our room. Sirens erupted constantly and loudly, as if we were on the 2nd floor. Trains rumbled by every so often, and planes could be clearly heard overhead. Luckily, we didn't spend much time in our room except to sleep. (Yes, I had brought ear plugs.) Otherwise, the room was comfortable if small. The bed and bedding were excellent. We could have done without the portraits of the brooding Native Americans over the bed, though. And the lighting was dim throughout. The iPod dock on the stereo didn't work, and a staffer sent to resolve the issue couldn't. Also, no HD TV channels worked. The staff was uniformly courteous, but there wasn't much they could do about some of the problems we encountered. It's wonderful that the building was renovated into a hotel, but why skimp on the windows and noise insulation on a busy Seattle street?

Reviews.Title: “a standout hotel - wish there were more like it”
Reviews.Author: lorisue6
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel. The rooms were beautiful and comfortable. It had an old world feel to it but everything was absolutely up-to-date. The location is ideal for exploring the city. My only regret is that we only had one night here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: grayling
Reviews.Content: Very nice quiet hotel. Location is good. Parking is the usual difficult Seattle situation. But they have a good valet service. Personal bathrobes, great views, good coffee in the rooms, and everybody was really nice.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaTravelerGirl
Reviews.Content: The location for this hotel is great. It is a historic hotel, but they've done a fantastic job with renovations. The bar has a professional bartender and is a great place to take advantage of happy hour. You will not want to miss the bakery next door to the hotel. I recommend this for breakfast! We did eat in the hotel for lunch and found it to to be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Quite an unexpected Serendipity!”
Reviews.Author: nexcen
Reviews.Content: The Arctic Club Hotel was merely accommodations we made for a weekend trip to see Seattle. Upon arrival, I had no idea I would literally step back in time to a day when collared shirts were required, service was impeccable with a gracious attitude, and social gathering around a large fireplace was proper and expected. Collared shirts are no longer required, but this exquisitely decorated historic hotel makes you feel like one of the club owners! Though renovated to what seems historic perfection, it offers modern day amenities like Jacuzzi tubs, flat screen TV’s, in-room wi-fi, CD/iPod player, Starbucks coffee, and even scotch tape and calculators for in-room officing… (BTW – who does that???) Little touches like historic fixtures, glassed-in bathroom doors, and even the flavor of a robust coffee poured straight from a French press give your stay that memorable feeling you so often hope to achieve on vacation. This place is a treat!

Reviews.Title: “Great value - new boutique hotel for a chain price”
Reviews.Author: septemberfalls
Reviews.Content: This is my new favourite hotel in Seattle! I have been wanting to stay at the Arctic Club since it opened last year, but the prices were too high. Since the hotel has been sold to Doubletree the prices have come way down, but you are still getting all the luxury add-ons - high thread count sheets, great mattress, nice fixtures in bathroom, and of course the great lobby and bar. The service was great - cookies upon arrival, and always greeted warmly by the front staff as we went in and out. We also ate at Juno (hotel restaurant) for breakfast - the french toast is excellent! The only negative was that during the day/early evening the traffic noise outside (we were facing the street) was quite loud. It died down at night and was no problem on the weekend though. I LOVE THIS PLACE!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel - Great Location, Service, and Value”
Reviews.Author: traveldude2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here overnight before catching a cruise out of Seattle bound for Alaska. This hotel was formerly the historic Arctic Men's Club from the early 1900's and they've refurbished it, preserving the warmth and history. Has the feel of a elite club with warm, comfortable common areas, never having the feel of a large, impersonal hotel. The room, 9th floor, seemed new (1 year old), perfectly decorated, and well appointed according to the hotel theme. The staff was very friendly and helpful in recommending local hotels and public transportation/taxis. Their in-house restaurant (JUNO) had a great breakfast, an excellent ambiance, and was surprisingly reasonable. The hotel is also right off 3rd Ave, which is where you can catch fee bus rides throughout the downtown area (if you don't want to walk a few blocks) which is great if you're tired from walking around downtown and want a quick ride back to the hotel. All this and it's conveniently located in the Pioneer Square area - walking distance to Pike's Market as well. Also, the underground bus system just opened and the hotel is 1/2 block from this as well (cheap travel to airport if needed). We've lived in Seattle before, and this is a perfect hotel from which to explore Seattle... Book online early and save a bundle on the room...

Reviews.Title: “The feeling of a private club in a small hotel”
Reviews.Author: feathers1959
Reviews.Content: The Arctic Club has successfully captured the feeling of a private club of the Alaska Gold era in Seattle, both from the decor and the service. The rooms are decorated in the gold rush period and have large, soft queen beds, bathrooms are adquate, and the room amenities are great--including the coffee press! The Juno resturant seems to open and close with the seasons, and the menu has gone a bit more mainstream for dinners, recently. Breakfasts are still "hearty". The bar scene seemed lively in April of 09.

Reviews.Title: “An Arctic Gem of a Hotel: cozy, comfy, clean, and very cool.”
Reviews.Author: mimi031
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this hotel. Great on-line price so nabbed it. Corner room with King bed and whirlpool tub. Lovely, high ceilings, super comfy bed and pillows. Elegant touches to the decor. Not your standard hotel room at all. Neutrogena amenities and complimentary extras that arrived promptly upon my request. Great office supplies/amenities such as calculator, tape, stapler, etc. Great french press coffee pot and good coffee. The robes were sumptious and terry on the inside, smooth hi-count thread cotton on the exterior. Appreciated the bathroom off the bedroom down a short hall with nice door. Made it feel like we were in a small apartment. Would have appreciated a light in the dark hall closet. A small fridge would also have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, Nice Hotel. Customer Service deteriorated noticably when ownership changed to Hilton Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: EU4
Reviews.Content: The Arctic Club Hotel is well situated on 3rd Avenue and Cherry St. in the Business district. The room (designated a disabled room) was spacious, with a flat floor WC / shower room (no steps). The bed was very comfortable although rather high for a disabled person. Coffee / Tea making available as well as TV / DVD / Radio / CD. Wardrobe contains a safe and ironing board and a low level clothes rail. (oddly no high level rail so long clothes / dresses couldn't be hung up) The Air conditioning fan was extremely noisy - to loud to have on at night. The TV was temperamental in receiving digital channels (which will be all of them after 12 June 2009). When we arrived Wifi internet was available throughout the hotel free of charge, but this stopped half way through the week. (See below) We arrived late on Saturday evening after a flight from London. Staff were helpful & friendly. The next day (Sunday) the area was quiet as it's the Business District. During the week the area is busier. Buses to & from the Retail Core (free until 7pm) run along 3rd Avenue and the are bus stops are right outside the hotel. There is a coffee shop on the opposite corner to the hotel and a Russian bakery next door (both open Mon-Fri only) if you don't fancy the hotel restaurant for breakfast. On the subject of the restaurant, in the course of a week we visited the restaurant 3 times (2 breakfast & 1 dinner). Monday breakfast was OK. Wednesday (note the day) dinner was a disaster. Had to wait an hour for our apetizers then the Entree (main course) arrived about 5 minutes later being placed on the table beside the apetizer plates we were still eating from. Glasses were taken before they had been finished and to top it all 2 of out party found plastic film in their food. Profuse apologies and a free glass of sparking wine followed, but the meal was spoiled. Saturday breakfast service was understaffed and inexperienced. Long waits for food, tables left uncleared and dirty crockery / cutlery provided. Generally the restaurant was hopeless. Half was though our stay (Wednesday) the ownership of the hotel passed to Doubletree, part of the Hilton group. From that moment onward there was a noticable decline in service. Internet connections stopped working (on enquiry I was told that the new owners had decided to charge $10 per day for access - there was no warning of this although it was still free in the lobby); the overnight laundry service took 4 days to return and the restaurant got worse. Not a bad hotel but things did change later in the week.

HotelInfo.Name: The Arctic Club Seattle - a DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 700 3rd Ave (corner of Third and Cherry - hotel entrance on Cherry Street), Seattle, WA 98104
